fruits.name: Rocket
fruits.description: Grants rocket propulsion for movement and explosive attacks. Abilities: Missile Fist, Air Strike, Rocket Crash, Blast Off.
fruits.wiki_description: Grants rocket propulsion for movement and explosive attacks. Abilities: Missile Fist, Air Strike, Rocket Crash, Blast Off.
fruits.page_description: Rocket (formerly known as Kilo) is a Common Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   5,000 or   50 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Rocket is similar to Bomb, both having moves that show explosion effects.
Rocket is the cheapest fruit to have a flight ability.
Rocket, Blade, and Eagle are the only fruits in which the [F] move has the highest mastery requirements out of all the other moves.

A physical Rocket fruit can be purchased from Wenlock in Arowe’s room for   97 (it says Physical Kilo, but buying it still gives the Physical Rocket).
This makes Rocket the only fruit that can be purchased as a physical fruit for   . Interestingly, the permanent version of Rocket is cheaper, costing only   50.
This makes Rocket the only fruit that can be purchased as a physical fruit for   . Interestingly, the permanent version of Rocket is cheaper, costing only   50.
Rocket and Slingshot both cost the same price.
Rocket, along with Spin, are the only fruits to always be in Stock.
When the user is on a flat ground with no obstacles, Rocket has the fastest mobility out of all common fruits.
If the user uses [F] Blast Off and quickly change to another slot, they will be able to blast themselves to the sky.

fruits.name: Spin
fruits.description: Allows spinning attacks and flight. Abilities: Razor Wind, Helicopter Flight, Tornado Assault, Spinning Bomber.
fruits.wiki_description: Allows spinning attacks and flight. Abilities: Razor Wind, Helicopter Flight, Tornado Assault, Spinning Bomber.
fruits.page_description: Spin is a Common Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   7,500 or   75 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Spin fruit is based on a twisted prism, a geometric design that helps reduce wind resistance.
Spin, along with Rocket, are the only fruits to always be in Stock.
Despite being more expensive than Rocket, many players regard Spin worse than Rocket as the damage dealt is slightly lower and it has less stun and combo potential.
Spin's pre-rework variant is used by the Marine Rear Admirals at Great Tree in the Third Sea.

fruits.name: Chop
fruits.description: Provides immunity to sword damage and chopping abilities. Abilities: Tackle, Dance, Party, Helicopter.
fruits.wiki_description: Provides immunity to sword damage and chopping abilities. Abilities: Tackle, Dance, Party, Helicopter.
fruits.page_description: Chop allowed the user to separate their body parts, utilizing them to dodge swords, deal close range attacks, and fly.
trivia: Although Chop's passive function was to avoid damage from sword slashes, Chop could also avoid swords that can create fire, freeze, cause electric shock, and even magic damage.
Chop was mostly known because of its sword immunity.
It was recommended to become a sword main instead of a fruit user when using Chop.
Most attacks looked weird with R15 and layered clothing since the user's body stretched and did not disconnect.

Chop was a very good replacement for elemental fruits to use at a low level since most enemies use swords in the First Sea, although it got bad quickly, getting outclassed in every way by higher rarity fruits because of its lack of abilities, and the fact that later NPCs (Second Sea and Third Sea) more commonly use Fighting Styles.
Chop's X move was similar to Shark Saw's [X] move.
Bobby, a Lv. 55 Boss, used Chop before Update 26.
Chop and Rocket were the only fruits in which the [F] move has the highest mastery requirements out of all the other move.
Chop is one of the only fruits whose reworks completely removed it from the game as Bobby/Chef no longer uses it.

fruits.name: Spring
fruits.description: Enables high jumps and spring-based moves. Abilities: Knock, Spring Snipe, Spring Cannon, Spring Leap, Spring Emperor.
fruits.wiki_description: Enables high jumps and spring-based moves. Abilities: Knock, Spring Snipe, Spring Cannon, Spring Leap, Spring Emperor.
fruits.page_description: Spring is a Common Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   60,000 or   180 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Spring is used by the Lv. 850 Boss, Jeremy.

There was a glitch with Spring’s [F] Spring Leap ability when, if it leaps into a chair in under one second, it allows the ability to continue forever if the user doesn’t move.
This glitch is now patched.
This glitch is now patched.
Spring has the potential to have possibly the worst [V] move in the game.
Similarly to Awakened Buddha's [V] move, Spring's [V] Spring Emperor can deal very high damage if used in an enclosed space.
Spring's [F] Spring Leap can go fast if it bounces off the sides of Second Sea's Bridge and can go faster than Light's [F].

fruits.name: Bomb
fruits.description: Allows creation of explosives. Abilities: Targeted Bomb, Explosive Jump, Bomb Grab, Land Mines, Self Destruct.
fruits.wiki_description: Allows creation of explosives. Abilities: Targeted Bomb, Explosive Jump, Bomb Grab, Land Mines, Self Destruct.
fruits.page_description: Bomb is a Common Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   80,000 or   220 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Bomb was known as the cheapest fruit before Update 17.3, along with Spike as the second cheapest.
Before Update 17.3, Bomb only had two moves, which were [Z] Snipe and [X] Ultimate Explosion.

Bomb's [C] Land Mines move is said to be the [C] move that deals the highest damage in the game (if all landmines are totaled when held). Although, it is almost impossible for the enemy to hit all landmines in PvP.
However, the player could use Shark Anchor's [Z] Move to make the opponent spin around and result in them exploding on multiple landmines.
However, the player could use Shark Anchor's [Z] Move to make the opponent spin around and result in them exploding on multiple landmines.
The old version of Bomb is used by the boss Stone along with the enemies Sorcerer, and Factory Staff.

Bomb's [V] Self Destruct currently has the highest knockback in the entire game.
This move is also the only move in the entire game to drain the user's HP.
This move is also the only move in the entire game to drain the user's HP.
Bomb's [X] Bomb Grab is very similar to Superhuman's [C] move, with the same sound effect and animation when dashing forward.

fruits.name: Smoke
fruits.description: Grants smoke manipulation for flight and logia immunity. Abilities: Smoke Slam, Smoke Bomber, Smoke Blast, Smoke Liberation.
fruits.wiki_description: Grants smoke manipulation for flight and logia immunity. Abilities: Smoke Slam, Smoke Bomber, Smoke Blast, Smoke Liberation.
fruits.page_description: Smoke is a Common Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   100,000 or   250 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Out of all fruits in the game, Smoke has the lowest mastery requirements to unlock all of its moves.
Smoke is currently the cheapest Elemental-type fruit.
Since the duration of [F] Smoke Bomber is infinite and the user can attack while flying, it is considered the best grinding move in Smoke's moveset.
Smoke is one of three Elemental-type Blox Fruits without an Awakening, the second being Blizzard, and the third being Gas.
Smoke is the only Common Elemental-type Blox Fruit.
Smoke is good for Sea Beast hunting due to the fact that every move can hit them.
The sound that plays during elemental immunity is the same as the Gas fruit.
NPCs cannot leave the AoE of [X] Smoke Blast until it ends.

fruits.name: Spike
fruits.description: Creates spikes for attacks. Abilities: Spike Summon, Whirlwind, Spiky Ball, Spike Barrage.
fruits.wiki_description: Creates spikes for attacks. Abilities: Spike Summon, Whirlwind, Spiky Ball, Spike Barrage.
fruits.page_description: Spike is a Common Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   180,000 or   380 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Spike is infamously known as the "Walmart Dough" because of its moves being similar to awakened Dough, specifically [X] (on ground) and [F] moves that compare to Spike's [Z] and [C] moves.

Spike used to always be in stock, along with Bomb, but this was changed when Rocket and Spin became the new two cheapest fruits.
Before Update 17.3, Spike had only two moves, which were [Z] Rush and [X] Spiky Ball.
Before Update 17.3, Spike had only two moves, which were [Z] Rush and [X] Spiky Ball.
The Factory Staff and Sorcerer use old Spike's [X] Spiky Ball.
Spike is currently the most expensive Common Fruit.
Spike is one of the only fruits without a transformation whose [C] move has longer cooldown and higher energy requirement than the [V] move.
Spike is the only Common fruit without a [F] move.

If aimed correctly, and if lucky, the enemy can get hit by more than one spike from Spike's [Z] and [V] moves.
Enemies with bigger hitbox have a higher chance to get hit by multiple spikes. (e.g. Buddha)
Enemies with bigger hitbox have a higher chance to get hit by multiple spikes. (e.g. Buddha)

Spike's [X] Whirlwind move's hitbox seems to only have a horizontal reach represented by the spinning hands, but it actually resembles more of a "square". This is supported by the fact that, if a NPC is lured under a tree, and the user uses this move while being on the tree, fully holding this move will reach and hit the NPC.
During the [C] Spiky Ball move, the user is able to jump. However, they cannot use neither double jump or Air Jump.

There is a bug that sometimes when the [C] Spiky Ball gets canceled, the rolling animation will play, and the user will "roll" forward as if they executed the actual attack. During this, the user is able to freely use all other abilities, and the effects of the bug will last for only 3 seconds.
There was a bug that when a physical Spike was held, its eyes were behind the model, not in front where they were supposed to be.

fruits.name: Flame
fruits.description: Fire-based projectiles and flight; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments. Awakened abilities include Blue Fire Bullets, Rocket Flight, etc.
fruits.wiki_description: Fire-based projectiles and flight; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments. Awakened abilities include Blue Fire Bullets, Rocket Flight, etc.
fruits.page_description: Flame is an Uncommon Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   250,000 or   550 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Flame fruit is used as the symbol in the Blox Fruits game logo.

The awakened [V] move shares its name with the ultimate fire spell from Elemental Battlegrounds (a game developed by Gamer Robot). The difference is that Elemental Battleground's spell Hell's Core creates an explosion around the user, unlike the move seen in Blox Fruits, which is a launchable fire bomb.
Flame, along with Ice and Quake, were the first fruits which received an awakening.
The awakened [Z] move has been reworked twice.
Flames unawakened [X] has been reworked 3 times.
Despite having control over fire, the user does not have immunity to lava which can be found at the Magma Village, Flame and Magma Raids, and the hot side of Hot and Cold.
Flame is currently the cheapest fruit to have an awakening.

Pre-rework awakened [Z] move used to have a visual glitch, where even if it seemed like it had disappeared (due to not hitting), it was still moving, invisibly. (The projectile would still hit despite it seeming like it had vanished.)
Before the rework, Flame's [V] move did not have the ability to charge up and deal more damage, it would just take around one second before being able to cast it.
Flames [V] move used to spin before it got reworked.
Flames [Z] move shares the same effect with Ice’s [Z] move, Ice Spears, but has different colors.
Flame’s [X] Move is weaker awakened if all tick damage is avoided. Barely hitting the enemy can cause this to happen.
Flame’s awakened [X] Move can be bugged to knockback NPCs even if it doesn’t hit. This is due to the way the script is made and thus still deals damage and knockback, just no effects.
Flame is currently the cheapest Uncommon fruit in the game.
Flame's [V] move had a bug where before the rework in update 17. It used to disappear and move similar to Rumble's [V] move, giving it bad range.
Flame's [Z] move before getting reworked used to have burn effect. However, the projectile would have a glitchy hitbox and may not register the hit.
Flame's [X] move before the rework had a bug where if it hit a player would make a explosion but the beam kept moving and expanding. Then made a 2nd explosion before ending.
Players can find Flame fruit meshes of the explosions during update 17.3 called firewind. They are still existing in the Roblox studio catalog.
Pre-rework awakened [Z] used to grow in size as it traveled, and would cast a bigger burning area when hit.
flame fruit along with dragon are the only confirmed fruits to use free models before being reworked.

fruits.name: Falcon
fruits.description: Bird transformation for flight. Abilities: Plumage, Wind Burst, Flight, Bone Crusher, Soaring Talons.
fruits.wiki_description: Bird transformation for flight. Abilities: Plumage, Wind Burst, Flight, Bone Crusher, Soaring Talons.
fruits.page_description: Falcon (formerly known as Bird: Falcon) was an Uncommon Beast-type Blox Fruit that used to cost   300,000 or   650 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Falcon was one of two Blox Fruits to have "Bird:" in their name, along Phoenix.
Falcon was the only Uncommon Beast-type fruit.
Falcon was the cheapest Beast Blox Fruit in money and value.

If the player used [Z] Plumage and switches to another Blox Fruit, they would keep Falcon's wings, along with the buffs.
The player would lose these wings when they died, switched teams, or left the game.
The player would lose these wings when they died, switched teams, or left the game.

Falcon was sometimes considered half-beast by the community, as it did not have a full transformation.
This was slightly justified, as it could see some use in most cases, though its moves were not very powerful by most measures.
This was slightly justified, as it could see some use in most cases, though its moves were not very powerful by most measures.

fruits.name: Ice
fruits.description: Ice attacks and freezing; walk on water; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments.
fruits.wiki_description: Ice attacks and freezing; walk on water; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments.
fruits.page_description: Ice is an Uncommon Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   350,000 or   750 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: [Z] Ice Spears used to be the Awakened [Z] move before it got reworked.
The user can wall run on an inclined walls by holding down [F] Ice Skating, and will run faster than usual if they try running straight on them.
[Z] Cold Storm is similar to Blizzard’s [X] White Out but slower.
It is possible to glitch through thin walls (for example: Mansion or Café walls) with [F] Ice Skating.
[C] Ice Bird is better than [C] Frozen Dragon for combos.
The player can use Flash Step onto the trail of ice on water.
Some skins can cause the trail of ice on water to be generated more slowly as players run.
[V] Absolute Zero shares the same name with the Aura Skin, Absolute Zero.

Ice and Light are the only fruits that have a unique weapon that can be used when equipped (Gas and Blade could be considered yet another one with a weapon of its own, just not visible to the naked eye).
[C] Frozen Dragon's stun time depends on how far the enemy is (i.e. the further the enemy is from the user, the longer the stun).
Ice shares the Frost Walker passive with Yeti, with both having the same purpose and similar path models.
Sometimes, [V] Absolute Zero can make the animation in air, but the AoE does not appear in the floor.
Ice’s Elemental Reflex sound is the same as Blizzard's.

fruits.name: Sand
fruits.description: Sand manipulation; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments; double damage in water.
fruits.wiki_description: Sand manipulation; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments; double damage in water.
fruits.page_description: Sand is an Uncommon Elemental-type Blox Fruit which allows the player control over sand and costs   420,000 or   850 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Sand is the one of the only Blox Fruits that has a passive which gives a disadvantage to the user in the game, along with Control.
Awakened Sand's [F] move shares the same name as Blizzard's [F] move - Tornado Flight.
The [Z] and [X] move's (both awakened and unawakened) range increases depending on the mastery.
Sand currently has the slowest flight in the game.

fruits.name: Dark
fruits.description: Dark energy attacks; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments.
fruits.wiki_description: Dark energy attacks; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments.
fruits.page_description: Dark is an Uncommon Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   500,000 or   950 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Dark is not great for aerial combat (unawakened), thus Angel race would be an effective counter.

The Dark raid NPCs have low damage but the player will have a high chance of death if they get stuck in a Dark user's Black Hole move, since it keeps them in place and allows the rest of the Raid NPCs to attack them freely. It is recommended to have a Buddha user.

To the average eye, there is only one mobility move. However, skilled players can take advantage of another potential mobility move, which is the awakened [Z] move, Dimensional Slash. In a fight, the user can confuse enemies by using Dimensional Slash on an NPC to quickly teleport away.

Dark's [X] Black Spiral move instantaneously teleports to its maximum range when it is aimed at an open space in the air. It is especially dangerous when using shift-lock (whose default direction is forward) during aerial combat.
[F] Ghastly Step has a much shorter range than Flash Step though can be used in the air.

There is a glitch involving Dark [C] not allowing itself to hit Buddha users. This could be most likely due to the confusing hitbox of Buddha. To deal with this, aim it at the body of the Buddha user as that is where the main hitbox mainly is located.

The old version of Dark is used by the Raid Boss, Darkbeard, the Dark Raid NPCs (Darkness/Dark users), the Possessed Mummy NPCs and the Elite Pirate, Diablo (the awakened version), as well as the NPCs and Boss in the Hell Dimension in the Cursed Dual Katana Puzzle.
The Dark users in the Dark Raid are not called Dark Users, instead they are called Darkness Users.
Pre-rework unawakened [V] used to have a bigger explosion.
Awakened Dark [Z] Dimensional Slash have same sound effects with Dark Blade [X] Dark Air Slash.
There's a bug where if the user uses Unawakened [Z] Dark Rocks and unequips/switches to another item in their hotbar after releasing the move, they'll be able to move around while throwing the rocks.

fruits.name: Diamond
fruits.description: Diamond hardening for defense and attacks.
fruits.wiki_description: Diamond hardening for defense and attacks.
fruits.page_description: Diamond is an Uncommon Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   600,000 or   1,000 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: [TAP] Radiant Lunge is similar to an old move prior to the revamp, Beaming Tackle. Similarly, the revamped [X] Shard Storm is a rework of Diamond Hail, and [C] Shimmering Disruption is the newer Solar Flare.
The [Z] Encrust move, when used against a wall or corner, will deal around 3.5x more damage.
Diamond is one of the few fruits in the game that can actively distort enemies. Others are Gravity, Quake and Venom.
Diamond has one of the largest differences between its physical model and its fruit icon (both the face, stem, and overall shape).
Diamond is one of the two Uncommon fruits that is not Elemental and does not have an awakening.
Diamond is the only Natural Uncommon Blox Fruit.
Diamond is one of the only non-beast type fruits that can transform, the others being Rubber, Venom and Gas.

For some reason, if the user's character does not have skin, [Z] Encrust will not turn their character blue.
This may be because the new Diamond changes the color of the user's skin, like Rubber, instead of coating their avatar with a diamond texture, which was the old Diamond.
This may be because the new Diamond changes the color of the user's skin, like Rubber, instead of coating their avatar with a diamond texture, which was the old Diamond.

There's a glitch that can make the user avatar fling very far by using the [TAP] ability while using a certain Roblox avatar. This can also be done by jump-dashing and tapping if you have a weak device with high ping.
The eyes of the fruit in inventory are different from physical model.

fruits.name: Light
fruits.description: Light-based speed and attacks; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments.
fruits.wiki_description: Light-based speed and attacks; awakenable for 14,500 Fragments.
fruits.page_description: Light is a Rare Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   650,000 or   1,100 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: The light spear was extremely glitchy the first time it was updated. For instance, running against a low wall like the one in Jungle can make the user fall down while their character glitches. This was fixed a few hours or days later, during the Christmas Event.
In the first few updates, Light's sword (which is now a spear) used to be a separate item instead of being within the fruit.
Awakened Light has the second fastest flight speed in the game if the user is at full Health, behind Western Dragon.
Unawakened Light's flight move is uncontrollable and only flies straight. Fortunately, the awakened version can be controlled but can only make ~45 degree turns.

When flying with Light, if the user collides with any solid object, the user will bounce off it. This is because of the properties of light in real life, which make it bounce off of surfaces. This is also known as specular reflection.

If the player were using [C] Lightspeed Destroyer and get teleported (like during trials) or opponent out the server, the player will transform into a star (literally). The user still can use their abilities, but in the appearance of a star.
Light can be more effective in AFK grinding than Magma due to the light spear. Since the user can use an auto-clicker with it, Ice also works in this case.

Strangely, [V] Sky Beam Barrage is better in the matter that it breaks Instinct, though it lacks in the large AoE that the Awakened version has. The start-up lag of the unawakened version is also more noticeable like Lightning's [C] move.

[C] Lightspeed Destroyer, acts somewhat similarly to Portal's [Z] Portal Dash, as both moves involve the player teleporting to the enemy, dealing damage by kicking the target around, and smashing them down to the ground.
[X] Barrage of Light is very similar to Dragon's [C] Scorching Downfall.

Although Portal [C] World Warp is faster than [F] Shining Flight, [F] Shining Flight is good for getting to specific places on islands, like the top of the Great Tree, rather than the default spawn point of that island.
Despite light realistically having no stationary mass, Light Ray is able to knock targets into midair.
Due to a bug, Elemental Reflex doesn’t function at random times for an extended period, although this is extremely rare.
In the early days of Blox Fruits's development, the [V] move used to be the flight move instead of the [F], which was changed for release.
There is a bug with [C] Lightspeed Destroyer move in which it makes the user's accessory invisible (ex. Holiday Cloak, Kitsune Ribbon etc.)
The Light Raid's final island has a structure that is also used in Elemental Battlegrounds' light map. (a game also made by Gamer Robot)

If the user lands [C] Lightspeed Destroyer at high attitude, the enemy will fall more slowly than at low or on land because there's no ground for the final hit (which makes lag and screenshake). This makes it easier to combo but also does less damage.
Rarely, in some servers, if players use [X] Hand of the Emperor on ground, it will leave a permanent dust effect where it passed. This can make lag when looked.

Due to a bug, if the player commences a friendly match in colosseum or friendly arena and lose the match, the light spear will disappear. To get it back, the player needs to reset character (respawn).

fruits.name: Rubber
fruits.description: Rubber body granting immunity to guns and electric attacks.
fruits.wiki_description: Rubber body granting immunity to guns and electric attacks.
fruits.page_description: Rubber is a Rare Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   750,000 or   1,200 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Rubber is the only fruit having a resistance against three attack types. (Fruits, Guns and Fighting Styles)
Previously, Pole (1st Form) could not damage Rubber, which may have been a bug as it was changed in Update 20.
Rubber [F] is the highest impulse dash move in the game.
If used properly, the [F] move can be faster than Dragon's [F] at the start.
Rubber is one of the Blox Fruits to have gotten a rework in Update 17.3.
Rubber used to only cost   100,000, however, it now costs   750,000. (Maybe due to its Transformation buff)

Rubber was originally named Gum.
Rubber used to have a move called "Gum Rocket" which would function as a great mobility tool. This was replaced with "Transformation".
Some of Rubber's old moves used to be able to pick up physical fruit when dropped on the ground.
Rubber used to have a move called "Gum Rocket" which would function as a great mobility tool. This was replaced with "Transformation".
Some of Rubber's old moves used to be able to pick up physical fruit when dropped on the ground.
Despite being immune to Lightning, Rubber does not provide immunity to the attacks used by the Thunder God, due to him being a boss.
If Rubber's M1 attack is held while in the air and released while the user's mouse is on a menu button, they'll be able to stay in the air for a long time and then fall down.
Permanent Rubber costs the same amount of Robux   as Dark Blade.

If the player holds  or tap Cursed Dual Katana's [X] move, then quickly switch to [X] or [C] move of the Rubber Fruit when it is released, the transformed variant of the [X]/[C] move will be used, regardless of whether the player is in their transformed state.
The [Z] skill has the same name as the Phoenix unawakened [Z] move.
Rubber is the first ever fruit to have a M1 outside of a transformed or unawakened state.
Rubber M1, Z, X, and C changes color depending on the user's aura color, similar to Spider's V move (Heavenly Punishment).
Rubber is the only fruit to only have an M1 before unlocking an actual move, make this is the only fruit with a [Z] move mastery requirement of over 1.
Rubber is the first fruit to be a non-beast type fruit with a transformation, followed by Diamond and Venom in second, and Gas in third.
Rubber is based on the Gum-Gum fruit from One piece

fruits.name: Barrier
fruits.description: Creates barriers for protection.
fruits.wiki_description: Creates barriers for protection.
fruits.page_description: Barrier was a Rare Natural-type Blox Fruit that used to cost   800,000 or   1,250 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Previously, Barrier was the only fruit capable of changing color cycling between green and blue repeatedly.

fruits.name: Ghost
fruits.description: Revival and ghost form abilities.
fruits.wiki_description: Revival and ghost form abilities.
fruits.page_description: Ghost (formerly known as Revive) is a Rare Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   940,000 or   1,275 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Ghost is the third fruit to have a change in rarity, the first being Portal, the second being Love and the fourth being Creation.

The resurrection effect will last forever even if the user switches to another fruit. It only disappears when they die or exit the game. Also, the green effect can affect transformed fruits or moves like unawakened Dough's [F] move.
If the user dies by Water, the resurrection passive will not work.
[V] Ghost Busters does not stack damage from skills, but it does increase the hitbox.
[V] Ghost Busters masters up the fighting style or sword of the user no matter what they are using.
The ghosts in [V] Ghost Busters can sometimes be named "Elf". (Exclusive to Christmas Updates)
[C] Cries of the Underworld is similar to Sound's [X] Fortissimo but holdable.
[V] Ghost Busters can hit Ice Admiral with its moves.
Permanent Ghost's icon when stored in the inventory uses Revive's icon.
As of Update 26, when Ghost is equipped, the (slightly modified) Revive icon will be shown instead of the new icon.

fruits.name: Magma
fruits.description: Magma attacks with high damage; walk on water; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Magma attacks with high damage; walk on water; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Magma is a Rare Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   960,000 or   1,300 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: The reworked, unawakened version of Magma was created by Kio, also known as @LegendOfKio on X, a contributor who played an important role in remaking the entire fruit in Update 17.3.
If a boat collides with a magma puddle, it will immediately stop. If the player using Magma stands close to the boat, it'll move the player as well.
Magma is known to be one of the highest damage-dealing fruits in the game, when ignoring moves that require all or infinite damage.

The Magma Admiral and the Lava Pirates use the old unawakened version of Magma, both using only the [Z] (Magma Fist) and [X] (Magma Column) move. The Elite Pirate, Deandre, also uses the new awakened version of Magma.
Awakened Magma's [F] Beast Ride move has the same sound effect as a Sea Beast when spawning or deadly roar skill.
Magma used to take no energy when walking on water but this has since been changed.
Air Jumping and aiming [X] Volcanic Assault at the opponent from above removes knockback from the move, which can be useful to start a combo.
If lucky, and if aimed properly, Awakened Magma's [Z] Magma Shower move can do almost as much damage as the awakened [V] Volcanic Storm move.
[Z] Magma Shower has an incredible range, as the projectiles do not despawn even at 2500+ meters.
For some reason, Magma puddles reappear and disappear faster when the player is holding a move.

If the user uses Awakened Magma's [F] Beast Ride, jump, and then switch to another item after that (e.g. a fighting style) they will be flung very far. Although this is a glitch, it can be very useful while hunting Sea Beasts and Terrorsharks as it allows the player to sky camp above them and use the effect of gravity on their moves to kill them while taking minimal to no damage. The direction you go depends on your mouse (PC). Not switching to another weapon/item will make you still go fling, but less distance. To go up, simply look up. putting your mouse right at your avatar doesn't work.

If a player holds a Magma fruit for about a second, and unequips it (not dropping), and then re-equips it in a different area, a singular magma droplet (from the special effect of the physical fruit) will appear in the area where the fruit previously was.
Sometimes Magma's [V] Volcanic Storm glitches, causing the attack to stay in held form.

fruits.name: Quake
fruits.description: Earthquake waves; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Earthquake waves; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Quake is a Legendary Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,000,000 or   1,500 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia:
Quake's [V] move has the largest AoE in the game.
This move can be used to grind efficiently many enemies at once in large areas such as the Cursed Ship or the Haunted Castle.
This move can be used to grind efficiently many enemies at once in large areas such as the Cursed Ship or the Haunted Castle.
The old and unawakened version of Quake is used by Greybeard.
Quake is good for raids because of the [V] move that deals massive damage and has a large AoE on both awakened and unawakened. It also has two skills that can stun the boss (if awakened).
Although Quake's awakened [V] Seaquake has two extra tsunamis, they do less damage than Quake's unawakened [V] Dual Tsunami. Seaquake does extra damage and stuns with the ground smash.

Quake is the only awakened fruit with only four moves instead of five, due to the fruit's lack of the [F] move, mainly known to be a method of mobility. It is also the only legendary fruit to not have a [F] move.

Quake is the most common Legendary fruit due to it being the cheapest of its rarity. As such this fruit is commonly used to buy Phoenix and Dough raids and given to Trevor to gain access to Don Swan's room.
Quake is the first Legendary fruit to have an awakening.
Quake has unique fragment costs due to it only having four moves when fully awakened.
This is the third most expensive fruit to awaken. Additionally, its [V] Seaquake is the most expensive move to awaken.
Quake is one of the only fruits to get its icon changed.
Quake's unawakened [V] move has a glitch when used in raids since frequently, it can move very slow and despawn not dealing any damage or sometimes even submerge below the ground/water.

fruits.name: Buddha
fruits.description: Giant form with damage reduction; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Giant form with damage reduction; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Buddha (formerly known as "Human: Buddha") is a Legendary Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,200,000 or   1,650 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia:
Rabbit does add speed, but the difference is less when transformed. This is because Rabbit's buffs for Buddha got nerfed.
Accessories provide speed boosts normally.
Pilot Helmet and Rabbit V2 will allow the user to move at a moderate speed, and the Agility (V3 ability) can help if the player is not in Third Sea.
Accessories provide speed boosts normally.
Pilot Helmet and Rabbit V2 will allow the user to move at a moderate speed, and the Agility (V3 ability) can help if the player is not in Third Sea.
Draco's V2 flight ability and Flash Step is significantly buffed while in Buddha form, letting the user fly much higher and their Flash Step having much larger AoE.

Buddha's unawakened total damage reduction when stacked with full body Aura of 54%, while the awakened form has 61%.
Using Shark V3 while wearing the Leviathan Shield will make the user's defense (against Melee/Sword/Gun attacks) up to 90%, or 79.14% by using Cyborg V3.
Sound's Tempo Meter can also add additional defense and extra speed.
Using Shark V3 while wearing the Leviathan Shield will make the user's defense (against Melee/Sword/Gun attacks) up to 90%, or 79.14% by using Cyborg V3.
Sound's Tempo Meter can also add additional defense and extra speed.
Unawakened Buddha moves can be used while in awakened form, however, awakened moves cannot be used in unawakened form.
The [Z] move is the only move necessary for the defense and range buff, so instead of getting full mastery, it is recommended to just get the first move.
Players at the middle of the awakened [C] move's explosion (direct hit) will take around 2x more damage than players around the explosion.
Although the awakened moves of Buddha have large AoE, damage, and stuns, most people only awaken the [Z] move and rarely the [F] move for the damage reduction and slight mobility.
Buddha is a great choice to grind with, but Elemental fruits are far better choices in First Sea due to them being easier to obtain.

fruits.name: Love
fruits.description: Love-themed attacks; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Love-themed attacks; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Love is a Legendary Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,300,000 or   1,700 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Love previously was not very rare but had exceptionally high combo potential if used correctly.

Love is one of the few fruits that have abilities that resemble Transformation. While the user doesn't technically "transform" into the respective thing the fruit is named after, the [F] Flamingo Ride ability disables all weapons except for the fruit, similar to many other transformations. The other fruit that can "transform" is Ghost.
While Ghost indeed does transform into the respective thing, the transformation is only triggered by death, as the [V] move doesn't really count.
While Ghost indeed does transform into the respective thing, the transformation is only triggered by death, as the [V] move doesn't really count.

Love's [X] move had the longest range in the game (even more than Pain) if the user aimed it correctly at another player's body (this did not apply to NPCs). Unfortunately, this was patched in Update 24.
Love is widely considered to be one of the most annoying and difficult fruits to fight against, mainly due to its Lovestruck passive, high range, and skycamping capabilities.

The NPC spawned from [V] Besto Friendo can sometimes trick exploit scripts and make exploiters follow the NPC in an attempt to kill it but won't deal any damage if their PvP is off, effectively rendering the script useless, unless the exploiter is online while farming, but it is very unlikely.
If the user has spawned a Friend from Love's [V] Besto Friendo and dies, the Friend will die as well.

The Friend's health and damage scale off the user's current level. Their health is user's level multiplied by 2, and their M1 damage is user's level divided by roughly 1.65 (ex. user's level is 2650, so the Friend's health will be 5300 HP, and their M1 will deal around 1609 damage.)
Love's [X] and [C] move can only be held for 7.5 seconds.

There's a bug/glitch where, if the user uses Love's [F] Flamingo Ride move and has console mode active, the user is able to use their Fighting Style, Sword, and Gun while riding on the flamingo. This is most likely patched.

Love's flight ability is one of the only fruits that allows the player to stop moving in mid-air and heal naturally while in flight. The other fruits that can do this are Eagle, Phoenix, Gravity and Dragon.
Love's [F] Flamingo Ride previously was able to fly in boats.
The former Lv. 1675 boss (Island Empress) used the Z, X, and V moves of old Love fruit.

There is a glitch/bug that allows more than four players in the same raid at a time by using Love's [F] Flamingo Ride and having an allied player on the flamingo and both in the raid tube at the same time. However, mounted players cannot deal damage in raids, and they don't get rewards. This can also be done with Kitsune, by having an allied player mount on the Kitsune user while transformed.
Love is the only fruit that uses an In-game friend's Avatar.

There is a glitch where if someone uses Love's [V] move, Besto Friendo, perfectly on a chair like in Mansion or Café (the ones utilized for Trading), other players will not be able to sit on that chair for the rest of the duration of the server.
This can be used for trolling people, by using Besto Friendo on a chair on each pair of chairs, making trading impossible.
This can be used for trolling people, by using Besto Friendo on a chair on each pair of chairs, making trading impossible.
The flamingo on the [F] move wears the Heart Shades accessory.
This is the first ever fruit to be able to carry other players (on the flamingo).

fruits.name: Spider
fruits.description: String manipulation; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: String manipulation; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Spider (formerly known as String) is a Legendary Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,500,000 or   1,800 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia:
Spider is used by Swan and Don Swan.
Swan has a unique move, the move being Multi-directional Silk.
With that, Don Swan has another version aside from the awakened and unawakened version of Spider. However, this version is only available in the second stage. It is an improved Spider [V] and [X], the [V] is a triple version of the unawakened [V], tripling the range, AoE and damage in the process, and the [X] shoots more Multi-String Attacks in an X pattern. However, due to this version being only available to a boss, it is impossible to find out whether there are any other differences.
Swan has a unique move, the move being Multi-directional Silk.

With that, Don Swan has another version aside from the awakened and unawakened version of Spider. However, this version is only available in the second stage. It is an improved Spider [V] and [X], the [V] is a triple version of the unawakened [V], tripling the range, AoE and damage in the process, and the [X] shoots more Multi-String Attacks in an X pattern. However, due to this version being only available to a boss, it is impossible to find out whether there are any other differences.
Despite it being called "Spider", it is not a Beast type fruit because it allows players to control strings rather than transform into a spider.
Spider is the second fruit that has a Beast themed Natural type fruit, the first one being Venom.
The current unawakened [F] Spider Path is actually the pre-rework awakened String's [F] Spider Highway.
Every awakened move of Spider can be held to deal more damage, but that does not mean it can be held indefinitely.
Many consider Spider's [C] Over-heated Sniper move to be better than the awakened version because of its range, Instinct break, and damage.
Spider has the biggest fruit model.
Spider's [Z] Spider Wraith uses the same sound effect as Cyborg V4's Energy Control Super Jump.
Spider's [C] Over-heated Sniper has a longer lasting tripwire effect than Buddy Sword's [X] Lightning Wave.

Formerly, the title awarded upon awakening at least one move of this fruit was "The Joker". People that awakened this fruit prior to the title change will still be able to use it, but it is no longer obtainable.

fruits.name: Sound
fruits.description: Sound waves for attacks; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Sound waves for attacks; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Sound is a Legendary Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,700,000 or   1,900 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Sound is the first fan-made fruit to be added to the game. The original concept was created by @Aqu4G (on X/Twitter), one of the winners of the first fan fruit/art contest. The second is the Kitsune fruit.
Many of Sound's moves contain musical vocabulary, such as Tempo (rate of speed of music played), Prestissimo (very fast) or Fortissimo (very loud).
While using [F] Tempo: Prestissimo, the user can fly faster (or even faster with the Tempo Meter activated) when their health is low, but not as fast as Venom (it also has the same flight mechanic).

Sound now allows for the newest, highest potential speed for a player in the game, by combining the following: Maximum Tempo Meter + Rabbit V4 (and Agility) + Pilot Helmet. However, this is still not the fastest transportation method, as Portal has the ability to instantly teleport to most islands in any sea.

Sound is the second least expensive fruit to have a meter, but also a variable meter.
Sound is also one of the fruits that have meters that are not intended for transformation, with the others being Gravity, Shadow, Creation, and Spirit.
Sound is also one of the fruits that have meters that are not intended for transformation, with the others being Gravity, Shadow, Creation, and Spirit.

fruits.name: Phoenix
fruits.description: Phoenix transformation with regeneration; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Phoenix transformation with regeneration; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Phoenix (formerly known as Bird: Phoenix) is a Legendary Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,800,000 or   2,000 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Currently, Buddha and Phoenix are the only Beast-type fruits to have an awakening.

Because of the Phoenix Flames and Feathers' Immortality passive on the [F] move, the user can stall above enemies and damage them, making it an ideal way to AFK farm money/mastery.
Smoke and Blizzard also technically have infinite damage moves, but their moves need to be held.
Smoke and Blizzard also technically have infinite damage moves, but their moves need to be held.
Phoenix is the first fruit to have a Mastery Requirement in order to obtain a chip for a raid.
Currently, Phoenix is one of the few fruits to have ranged M1s.

The unawakened [X] move somehow heals faster than the awakened version.
Phoenix is the first ever fruit to possess HP benefits. (excluding pre-nerf Buddha)
Phoenix is the first ever fruit to possess HP benefits. (excluding pre-nerf Buddha)

The transformed Phoenix resembles a creature found in Chinese myths known as Fenghuang. The Phoenix is supposed to be a symbol of grace and virtue, an immortal bird that represented beauty. Its Blox Fruits counterpart, however, depicts the Phoenix as a violent and fiery beast. This depiction is closer to the Western Phoenix, despite having the traits and features of the Fenghuang.
[F] Swift Flight can be used to damage Sharks or the Leviathan while other players are attacking just by still staying on top.

If the player uses awakened [C] or [Z] while using the unawakened transformation, the transformation will be cancelled.
Interestingly, the awakened version loses the earpiece on the flight move, and attacks.
Interestingly, the awakened version loses the earpiece on the flight move, and attacks.
If the player starts using the transformed [X] move before being kicked out of transformation via low energy, they will shoot the transformed version instead of the normal [X] move.
Awakened Phoenix's [X] move can be used with the V1 [V] move. If used with transformation, it will make the user's speed become a little slower.
Holding the unawakened [X] move is a highly recommended way to get the title "Empty Vessel".
Phoenix is the first fruit that can transform without a fury meter, the second being Leopard, the third being Mammoth and the fourth being Yeti.

Sea Beasts will appear in a Phoenix raid, specifically on the 4th and 5th islands. These Sea Beasts do not drop anything and are optional to fight during the raid, as only the enemies on the raid island are required to progress to the next island. However, it is advised to defeat these Sea Beasts if possible, as they pose as extreme threats to those on the raid island. Fruits such as Buddha and Yeti are recommended against these Sea Beasts.

When paired with Blood Siphon (Gear 2), the Lei accessory, gathering 5–8 enemies then using Skull Guitar [X] with the Vampiric III enchant, and activating [X] Blue Flames can result in the fastest health regeneration within the game.
Although Phoenix and Portal share the robux price of (  2,000), they do not share the same Money   value. Phoenix is valued at   1,800,000 and Portal is valued at   1,900,000.
In awakened form, due to the 33% hp rule, if the player resets their character or dies while transformed, they will untransform before dying, unlike other beast fruits.
Phoenix is the only fruit with a transformation that can be ended in a way other than emptying a fury meter. (This way being having below 33% hp or energy).
Phoenix (V2) is a balance between hunting bounty/PvP and grinding, as of short cooldown for most skills.

fruits.name: Portal
fruits.description: Portal creation for teleportation; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Portal creation for teleportation; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Portal (formerly known as Door) is a Legendary Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,900,000 or   2,000 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: The teleport moves do not teleport people if they have PvP disabled or if they are in a Safe Zone and not allied to the user.
Portal is the first fruit that has a teleport move that other players can access.
Although Portal and Phoenix share the robux price (  2,000), they don't share the same value. (Portal is valued at   1,900,000, while Phoenix is valued at   1,800,000).
Portal is the first fruit that is able to bring up a separate GUI.
Alongside the teleport move, Portal has the most mobility moves at four. (Phoenix is second at three)
The permanent version of Portal has a lot of value, mostly because of its [C] move as it can teleport nearly anywhere.
Midnight Blade and Bizarre Revolver creates portals similar to those created by Portal.
None of Portal's moves have destructible physics
Can be used to glitch through some walls (Ex: Igloo entrance on the cold side of Hot and Cold in the Second Sea).
Shortest cooldown at 2–2.5 seconds, but it has since been nerfed to 4 seconds.
The user may use any ability in the game in this state, but it will end this move.
When using this ability and passing through [C] World Warp from the enemy, the invisible duration will reset upon teleportation, causing the user to become invisible again.

The user can also teleport to the cursed ship without reaching Lv. 1000 through the use of this move. The enemies will still drop Ectoplasms and the user will be able to talk to the NPCs, however, the Cursed Captain will not drop the Hellfire Torch to the player, and they will not be able to accept any quests (because of the level requirement).
This is a great move for escaping Portal [V] loopers as this move cannot be canceled when used no matter what damage is taken.

This move could actually deal damage, even to the user. However, the amount of damage dealt was 1 damage or less, which is also why when the user teleported through the portal, the health bar on the top right appeared instead of being hidden.

This move could teleport the user out of a raid and still keeps the timer. This means if the raid was beaten, they would still be awarded the fragments even if they did not actively participate in the raid. When outside the raid, the user was immune to the attacks of other players. (This has been patched in Update 27.0)
The new reworked Portal C Gui shows how each teleport location looks making it easier for new players to understand Dock 1, 2, 3, 4 more easily.

There's a bug that could happen by someone letting the player enter [V] Dimensional Rift and then immediately quit the game. This leads to players being able to turn off fog, which effectively helps to clarify vision.
If the player is launched out of the dimension through the top portal by a high-knockback move, such as Godhuman [C], a bug may cause them to end up in a void far away from the islands.
Sometimes, when the dimension despawns and a player is in it, they will fall from the sky, high above the islands.
The user can use this to "swap places" with an enemy. However, if they use this when the enemies are really close to them, they will be at the portal where the user exits.
The portals can still be used while in the void from Parallel Escape, which means that the user can use this move for transporting/escaping quickly on the battlefield.

Can be opened up at any position and distance between each other, so the user can essentially trap NPCs/bosses/players in an infinite loop dealing massive damage to them along with the minor stun damage dealt from entering the portal.

fruits.description: Lightning strikes; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Lightning strikes; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Redirect to:

fruits.description: Paw pads to repel attacks; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Paw pads to repel attacks; awakenable.

fruits.name: Blizzard
fruits.description: Snow storms; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Snow storms; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Blizzard is a Legendary Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   2,400,000 or   2,250 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Blizzard is the third most expensive Elemental fruit, with Dough being the second, and Gas being the first.
Blizzard is the most expensive Legendary Fruit.
[V] Blizzard Domain has the largest AoE damage over time in the game, excluding Full Transformed Dragon [C] Scorching Downfall.
A distinct sound effect will play if the player holds one of Blizzard's moves for at least a second, which is the same as Ice.
Every move of Blizzard can break objects with Destructible Physics.
[F] Tornado Flight has the same name as Awakened Sand's [F] Sand Flight.
[F] Tornado Flight is highly recommended for Ship Raids as it does a lot of continuous damage.
Blizzard's mastery requirements have the same amount as Rumble's and Phoenix's.
Blizzard is one of the three Elemental Fruits which do not have an awakening, alongside Smoke and Gas.

fruits.name: Gravity
fruits.description: Gravity control for meteors and lifts.
fruits.wiki_description: Gravity control for meteors and lifts.
fruits.page_description: Gravity is a Mythical Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   2,500,000 or   2,300 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Gravity is the cheapest Mythical fruit in the game.
The second rework concept of the Gravity moves was created by concept artist @crazy_rtx.
Gravity is the only fruit in the game to have 3 variants of its [M1] attacks.
As of now, Gravity is the only fruit with 13 abilities, making it the fruit with the highest number of skills in the game (including [M1] clicks).
The boss Orbitus uses a slightly altered version of Gravity, though the style of the moves resemble the old one.
Gravity is one of the first two fruits that could obtain upgrades through the Admin Panel, the other being Eagle and soon, Creation.
Gravity is one of six fruits to have a meter that is not intended for a transformation.
Gravity is the only fruit in the game that requires the most tasks and items to fully upgrade it through the Admin Panel.
Gravity is the second fruit to have a cutscene, the first being Control.
Gravity currently has the longest cutscene of any fruit, being roughly 13.79 seconds.
Gravity has been reworked two times and has two moves that are uncancellable.
When going through doorways while flying, the boulder will purposely lower into the ground to allow the user to enter.
[C] Gravitational Prison's upgraded version is very similar to an admin ability called "Tensei".
The users are unable to use the max upgraded [TAP] Normal Attack while flying with Gravity. However, it still works even if they stop without ending the flight mode.
Removing the stage 2 [M1] shortens the time to reach stage 3, however removing the stage 1 [M1] causes the stage 3 animation to play for a short time before becoming normal.
A physical Gravity fruit can be dropped from defeating the Tyrant of the Skies, at a very low chance.
Gravity and Blade are the only fruits that have had their entire moveset reworked twice.
Gravity's [M1] has an alternative button on mobile located above [Z] Singularity that functions just the same as tapping, although resembles the activation of a move instead.
Unlike other M1 attacks on mobile, 2 clicks are required to activate the [M1] ability.
[C] Gravitational Prison's upgraded version seems to be inspired by Chibaku Tensei (Planetary Devastation) From the Naruto franchise
[V] Asteroid Crash's upgraded version also appears to have taken heavy inspiration from a scene in the Battle of Titan from Avengers: Infinity War[1]

fruits.name: Dough
fruits.description: Dough manipulation; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Dough manipulation; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Dough is a Mythical Elemental-type Blox Fruit that costs   2,800,000 or   2,400 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Dough is the second most expensive fruit to awaken, behind Lightning which costs 21,500 fragments

All of the awakened abilities are affected by Aura Colors, changing the outline in all the moves and "electricity" effects (the only other fruits in which the moves are affected by the Aura Color being Rubber and Spider).

Dough is the only fruit in the entire game who's attacks are buffed by Aura, specifically its [TAP] Normal Attack and [Z] Missile Jab when awakened.
Additionally, depending on whether the user has Aura activated or not, the sound effects of Dough's [TAP] Normal Attack and [V] Dough Fist Fusillade will be different.
Additionally, depending on whether the user has Aura activated or not, the sound effects of Dough's [TAP] Normal Attack and [V] Dough Fist Fusillade will be different.

There are multiple glitches with Dough, including:
The [X] Pastry River ability can get the user stuck in place and make them unable to move until they get killed or reset, and using the ability mid-air can sometimes result in the opponent getting glitched out of the map.
When the user uses [X] Pastry River (Air) on the player with at least 1 hp left, after respawning (if fist barrage is still going) when the downslam occurs, that player will be teleported in EXACT same place as the center of the downslam.
If the user is getting hit by the [V] Dough Fist Fusillade ability and someone attacks the Dough user, they will be locked in place until death or leaving.
This can also happen if the user is holding the ability and then exits the game.
If the user dashes, jumps, and uses the [TAP] Normal Attack all at the same time, they will dash further than normal, similarly to Skull Guitar, but less effective.

The [X] Pastry River ability can get the user stuck in place and make them unable to move until they get killed or reset, and using the ability mid-air can sometimes result in the opponent getting glitched out of the map.

When the user uses [X] Pastry River (Air) on the player with at least 1 hp left, after respawning (if fist barrage is still going) when the downslam occurs, that player will be teleported in EXACT same place as the center of the downslam.

If the user is getting hit by the [V] Dough Fist Fusillade ability and someone attacks the Dough user, they will be locked in place until death or leaving.
This can also happen if the user is holding the ability and then exits the game.
This can also happen if the user is holding the ability and then exits the game.
If the user dashes, jumps, and uses the [TAP] Normal Attack all at the same time, they will dash further than normal, similarly to Skull Guitar, but less effective.
When the user uses the [Z] Missile Jab or [X] Pastry River (Air variant) abilities, they can see that their arm disappears but rebuilds itself with mass.
Dough's unawakened [X] Sticky Dough and [C] Carved Dough abilities bear a visual resemblance to an ability from an old game made by mygame43, Elemental Battlegrounds.
If the user uses Dough's [C] Piercing Clothesline while not using any Aura Colors, the effects will be red by default.
If two Dough users use [C] Piercing Clothesline against each other, both of them will hit, but no one would take damage.
Dough’s [C] Piercing Clothesline (awakened/unawakened) can be used as an alternative for its [F] Scorching Donut move (awakened/unawakened), but only for up to four seconds.
[V] Dough Fist Fusillade will appear with bigger hands when used with aura, while without it will appear significantly skinnier.
Dough is the only Mythical fruit that can be awakened.

Dough is the first Mythical Elemental fruit, while the second is Gas.
Dough used to be a Natural fruit that had the Elemental Reflex passive only if the user's Instinct was turned on, but this was later changed, and Dough was made entirely Elemental.
Dough used to be a Natural fruit that had the Elemental Reflex passive only if the user's Instinct was turned on, but this was later changed, and Dough was made entirely Elemental.
Awakened Dough's [Z] Missile Jab ability projectile is actually a small aura-covered fist after being fired.
If the player uses the [C] Piercing Clothesline ability with Ghost's Resurrection Passive active, the swinging arm will appear translucent.

Repeatedly using awakened [TAP] Normal Attack and/or aiming the [V] Dough Fist Fusillade move in the same spot will leave a crack on the ground, which increases in size the more the user punches in that spot. When using [V] Dough Fist Fusillade, the crack will briefly appear "scorched".
As of update 27.1, if the user uses [C] Piercing Clothesline or [F] Scorching Donut in the Submerged Island, they will begin to rapidly accelerate upwards, either forcing them to exit or even drown.

fruits.name: Shadow
fruits.description: Shadow control and umbrakinesis.
fruits.wiki_description: Shadow control and umbrakinesis.
fruits.page_description: Shadow is a Mythical Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   2,900,000 or   2,425 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Shadow is the only fruit that allows the user to utilize the life drain mechanic (just like Ghoul's life leech) by using [C] Nightmare Leech.
Shadow is the only fruit with the Umbra Meter as it was designed only for itself.

"Umbra" in Latin means "shade" and/or "shadow", and "Corvus" in Latin refers to a "raven" or a "crow", both being types of birds. This ties into how many of the fruit's abilities have to do with crows/ravens flying at the enemy.
Shadow's [Z], [X], [C] moves are quite similar to Godhuman's [Z], [X] (Tap Variant) and [C].
Shadow is the rarest and most expensive fruit obtainable from a Fruit Box.
This fruit has low value in trading due the low versatility and overall negligence.

fruits.name: Venom
fruits.description: Poison clouds and attacks.
fruits.wiki_description: Poison clouds and attacks.
fruits.page_description: Venom is a Mythical Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   3,000,000 or   2,450 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Venom's transformation model was made by Mary (@Marubravery on X).
Venom is the only fruit that starts with the letter "V".
Venom shares similarities with Magma, as both have abilities that create puddles that cause damage over time. Their damage stacks as well, making them deal incredible amounts of damage.

When transformed, the user is "immune" to all environment lava puddles, such as those found in Raids or on the island Hot and Cold (this is because the hitbox when transforming is above the lava, preventing the user from taking damage). The user, however, can be harmed by the lava puddles by being dragged down by an ability such as Awakened Flame's [V].

There was a glitch when if the user transforms and immediately sits on a chair, the multi-headed dragon's walking, jumping and idle animation is replaced with a T-Pose that appears one second before the animations load in. Doing this does not drain the user's Fury Meter and jumping will make them Air Jump instead. After pressing [V] again, the game still believes the player is sitting and does not allow them to jump but they will be able to move. To be able to jump again, the player needs to either reset, get killed, or leave the game. This glitch has been patched.
Venom transformation works similarly to the Awakened Buddha, gaining reduced dash and acceleration buffs from accessories.
It is recommended to use Ghoul V3, Shark V2/V3 passive, or Human V3 while using Venom. Ghoul reduces cooldowns even more for Venom, Shark takes no damage in water and Human buffs the damage.
Venom has the one of the largest AoE in the game, which is [C] Toxic Fog when transformed. (The other being Awakened Quake [V], Blizzard [V], and transformed Eastern/Western Dragon [C] and [Z]).
Sometimes, transformed [C] Toxic Fog only does one cycle of poison damage. This could be a bug.
Despite Venom having a transformation and having a Meter mechanic, it is not a Beast fruit, making it the first and only Natural fruit with a transformation and a meter mechanic.

Venom is a good counter to Awakened Dough, as most of Dough's moves need to be held to deal maximum damage. Venom is able to interrupt Dough moves and combos very well, mainly Dough's [X] and [V] moves. However, using T-Rex transformation would be more effective.
Just like Dragon and T-Rex, Venom's Fury Meter needs 1 minute and 30 seconds to fully recharge.
Venom is the only Natural fruit to have a Fury Meter.
Venom is currently one of the Blox Fruits that are very outdated. (The other fruits being Control, and Shadow )
Venom, Spirit and Classic Dragon are the only fruits not to receive a model rework in Update 20.
Venom's flight move is one of the flight moves that, instead of getting slower the lower the user's health is, it gets faster, much like Sound.
Untransformed [C] is one of, if not, the quietest attacks of a fruit.

fruits.name: Control
fruits.description: Levitate and crush objects.
fruits.wiki_description: Levitate and crush objects.
fruits.page_description: Control is a Mythical Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   3,200,000 or   2,500 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.

fruits.name: Spirit
fruits.description: Summon spirits for buffs and attacks.
fruits.wiki_description: Summon spirits for buffs and attacks.
fruits.page_description: Spirit (formerly known as Soul) is a Mythical Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   3,400,000 or   2,550 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Cursed Tree is the only buddy whose form was not changed during the rework in Update 17.3.

Due to the nerf in update 24 to Angel's V3 ability, the healing ability of the stars offers a great alternative for those looking to heal in a pinch. Much like Angel's V3 ability, making it ideal in the heat of battle.

There was a bug where if the user activated the flying pig's speed and then switched to another permanent fruit, they could keep the speed from the flying pigs. This glitch could be stacked and therefore abused, as continuous repeating of it would lead to tremendous amounts of speed. Some YouTube videos even state that 2 dashes were enough to go across Castle on the Sea. (Patched in Update 20)
The [X] move has a visual bug that makes it slightly hard to land from afar, but it is easier to use when aiming under the user's avatar.
Spirit is also sometimes used in skilled builds as it requires moderate aim to use.

fruits.name: Dragon
fruits.description: Dragon transformation with fire breath; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Dragon transformation with fire breath; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Dragon is a Mythical Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   15,000,000 or   5,000 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: The Dragon Fruit can also be obtained from the    Dragon Eggs at the Prehistoric Island with an extremely low chance, being able to get either the East or West variants.
Dragon is the most expensive and difficult-to-obtain fruit in the game.
Before Update 24, Dragon was the third most expensive fruit in the game, with the first being Kitsune and the second being Leopard.
Before Update 17.3, Dragon was once again the most expensive fruit in the game, valued   3,500,000. This is the second time that Dragon is the most valuable fruit.

Pre-rework, Dragon costed   2,600, which increased by 92.3% up to   5,000 post-rework, making it by far the highest Robux price increase of any purchasable item in the game.
Similarly, it also has the highest Money price increase of any reworked item, going from   3,500,000 to   15,000,000. According to the calculations, the price of that is increased by 328.57%.
Similarly, it also has the highest Money price increase of any reworked item, going from   3,500,000 to   15,000,000. According to the calculations, the price of that is increased by 328.57%.
Mastery gained will be common to both Dragon variations.
Dragon has the largest transformed model in the game.

The transformed Eastern form dragon resembles a creature commonly found in Chinese myths, specifically a long, whereas the Western represents a European folklore Dragon, specifically a wyvern. Additionally, the Eastern Dragon is supposed to be the ruler of seas and bodies of water, unlike its Blox Fruits counterpart, whose moves are mostly fire-based.
Dragon's Western version is also similar to a fan-made Wyvern fruit showcased in the 2024 fan art competition.
Additionally, in most Chinese myths, Eastern Dragons are depicted to have control over the weather, thus allowing them to wield water, thunder and wind.
Dragon's Western version is also similar to a fan-made Wyvern fruit showcased in the 2024 fan art competition.
Additionally, in most Chinese myths, Eastern Dragons are depicted to have control over the weather, thus allowing them to wield water, thunder and wind.
Dragon and Kitsune are the only beast fruits that, while transformed, can carry players on their backs. However, Dragon needs Saddle/Strong Hair to carry someone on their back.
Dragon and Kitsune are the only fruits that can be obtained from Sea Events such as the Kitsune Shrine and Prehistoric Island.
The user can measure how fast they are moving using the Dragon's Hybrid form. The higher the speed, the higher the volume and pitch of the footsteps of the hybrid.
Dragon is the first fruit to have two versions on its transformation and fruit model.
Dragon has the highest damage reduction in the game.
Using a Race Awakening transformation while using the hybrid form drains the user's Fury Meter.
Having the permanent version of Dragon allows the user to choose the version of the fruit used. (Either Western or Eastern.)

Sometimes, a bug can happen with the Western Dragon where if the user untransforms, they will not be able to move. In the case of the Eastern Dragon, this bug causes players who untransformed to have a larger hitbox, allowing them to collect items such as fruits and chests much further than supposed and makes users sit in chairs frequently. This can be fixed by resetting the character or transforming into the hybrid form.

Dragon is considered one of the best fruits for Leviathan hunt because the M1 hybrid form can deal insane damage. The reason it's better than Magma is because its ability is easier to target than moving targets like segment and limits knockback when spamming M1. However, for the head, Magma is still better.
Interestingly, Dragon's icon in the shop is the only icon that goes out of the margin.
Dragon is the second fruit that has two icons, the other being Control.
Dragon's untransformed [C] Scorching Downfall has a similar look to Light's [X] Barrage of Light.
The icon on inventory of the permanent dragon looks merged.
Dragon is the first fruit in the Stock menu to have a unique plaque, being changed in Update 24.
There is a glitch where discounted Dragon appears on the recommended fruits bar.
There is a glitch where if the player transforms, they are sometimes "invisible" to other players.
Dragon was the first fruit to receive the 'in-progress' status, followed by Gravity as the second, both Barrier and Falcon as the third, Pain as the fourth, and Rumble as the fifth.
Dragon (East)'s full transformation emits growling sounds, unlike the Western counterpart.
As of Update 27.1, Dragons are rollable for the first time since Updates 22-23.

Due to recent changes of the Dragon (especially East), Sea Beasts can drain the user's Fury Meter to negative.
Cyborg's Energy Core V3 ability can also drain Dragon (East)'s fury meter in seconds.
Cyborg's Energy Core V3 ability can also drain Dragon (East)'s fury meter in seconds.

fruits.name: Leopard
fruits.description: Leopard form with speed and power.
fruits.wiki_description: Leopard form with speed and power.
fruits.page_description: Leopard is a Mythical Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   5,000,000 or   3,000 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: During Leopard's Transformation ([V]), the user will gain a moderate speed boost/buff. Using Rabbit V3 and the Pilot Helmet add up even more speed buffs. Combining all of them can make the user surpass the speed of Awakened Light's [F] (Shining Flight), which is the second fastest flight move in the game.

When transformed, the user is "immune" to all environment lava puddles, such as those found in Raids or on the island Hot and Cold (This is because the hitbox when transforming is above the lava, preventing the user from taking damage). The user, however, can be harmed by the lava puddles by being dragged down by an ability such as Flame's V move.

After the usage of [C] Afterimage Assault, the user will gain a temporary but strong speed boost/buff and giving them slightly faster M1's while being lit on fire. Keep in mind that this effect will not change any other attribute/aspect of the user. (Damage, Defense, Health, etc.)
This move can also be added onto the transformation combination to make it even faster.
This move can also be added onto the transformation combination to make it even faster.

Mammoth, Eagle, Buddha, Yeti, Phoenix, and Leopard transformations do not have a time limit or Fury Meter unlike fruits such as Dragon, Venom, T-Rex, Gas or Kitsune without getting damaged, which means the user can stay transformed for as long as they like.
The exception is Phoenix's transformation, since it depends from amount of energy and HP the player has.
The exception is Phoenix's transformation, since it depends from amount of energy and HP the player has.
Jumping into [X] Spiraling Kick while it is moving will cause it to carry the player forward for a short distance. Do note that this most often works on devices with poor connections.

When transforming, a faint leopard ghost appears above the user with red glowing eyes for a few milliseconds. If the player is entering the server for the first time, the leopard model may sometimes appear T-posing.
Leopard's [M1] attacks (Roar) can damage Sea Beasts.

Leopard is widely considered a spammable fruit. Using the combination of Zebra Cap, Ghoul V3/V4, which has the ability to reduce cooldowns, will massively contribute to the fruit's spammability, so much that if used properly, the player can almost use the moves continuously.
When transformed, the player keeps their hair/hat.
Yeti and Leopard are the third pair of fruits to share the same price, the second being Gas and Control, and the first being Mammoth and T-Rex.
Yeti is considered the rival of this fruit.
[Z] Finger Revolver and [X] Spiraling Kick can fling fruits on the ground.

fruits.name: Kitsune
fruits.description: Fox transformation with illusions and blue fire; awakenable.
fruits.wiki_description: Fox transformation with illusions and blue fire; awakenable.
fruits.page_description: Kitsune is a Mythical Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   8,000,000 or   4,000 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia:
Kitsune is the second fan-made fruit to be added to the game, with the first being Sound.
The original concept was created by @Kuzuryu_Kei (X Handle), one of the winners of the first fan fruit/art contest.
The original concept was created by @Kuzuryu_Kei (X Handle), one of the winners of the first fan fruit/art contest.
Kitsune is currently the second most expensive fruit in the game.
Kitsune is the first Beast fruit that allows allied players to mount, the second being Dragon.
It is worth noting that Agility (Rabbit's V3 ability) does not have nearly as much effect as when not transformed. While it is noticeable, it is mostly negligible.

Despite being based on a nine-tailed fox, Kitsune normally only has three tails and five tails when transformed; this is probably due to the design of the model, although it still has nine tails in the icon.
The same happens to Inventory Icon and Physical Fruit, while the Inventory Icon model has 4 tails, Physical Fruit only has 3 tails.
The same happens to Inventory Icon and Physical Fruit, while the Inventory Icon model has 4 tails, Physical Fruit only has 3 tails.
When walking whilst using Kitsune with two or more tails, the player animation will shift from crawling on all fours to an upright & happy skipping animation.

Kitsune used to have a move called "Tailed Beast Bomb" as its [C] move, which got changed into "Fox Fire Disruption" and the [F] move, "Wild Assault" , was called "Swift Assault" in the fruit's sneak peek.
All of Kitsune's moves (excluding [V]) can only be held for 12 seconds.
In the fan made design, the [X] move was called "Claws of Burning Agony" which was changed to "Tails of Burning Agony" in the game.
A physical Kitsune Fruit can also be obtained at a very low chance (0.1%) by offering Azure Embers to the Kitsune Shrine in the Third Sea.

There was a bug involving Love's [F] Flamingo Ride, where If an allied player mounted the Kitsune user, the Love user could "kidnap" the allied player, and that player would ride on the Flamingo. However, once the Love user cancelled their [F] Flamingo Ride, the player who was previously mounting the Kitsune user would teleport back into the saddle. This bug is now patched.

fruits.name: T-Rex
fruits.description: T-Rex transformation with massive strength.
fruits.wiki_description: T-Rex transformation with massive strength.
fruits.page_description: T-Rex is a Mythical Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   2,700,000 or   2,350 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: T-Rex has been nominated to be added to the game since Update 7.

T-Rex has the same price as Mammoth, both costing   2,700,000 or   2,350.
This also makes T-Rex one of the only fruits that share a monetary value with another fruit, with the second being Control and Gas, and the third being Leopard and Yeti.
Even though T-Rex has the same value as Mammoth, however, T-Rex has more demand in terms of trading.
This also makes T-Rex one of the only fruits that share a monetary value with another fruit, with the second being Control and Gas, and the third being Leopard and Yeti.
Even though T-Rex has the same value as Mammoth, however, T-Rex has more demand in terms of trading.
T-Rex is one of the few fruits to leave effects on nearby users' screens when using a move/transformation.

The player has a tail while they have T-Rex equipped. This is only cosmetic and does not add anything, unlike Kitsune's Tails.
This also adds to the fact that T-Rex is one of the only Beast fruits to add cosmetics to the user, along side Eagle.
This also adds to the fact that T-Rex is one of the only Beast fruits to add cosmetics to the user, along side Eagle.

Due to the infliction of tick damage on enemies during the transformation, T-Rex can excel in PvP, being able to damage the enemy even at exceedingly high distances. It can also let the user see where the opponent is, making it very hard for them to escape.
The Prey Mark's tick damage works best when inflicting damage and then getting teleported to Portal's [V] (Dimensional Rift).
This also works surprisingly well with it's [C] (World Warp).
The Prey Mark's tick damage works best when inflicting damage and then getting teleported to Portal's [V] (Dimensional Rift).
This also works surprisingly well with it's [C] (World Warp).

For some reason, using T-Rex will grant a higher chance of marking the user's kill as a "Suspicious Kill" (which doesn't reward bounty for the kill and doesn't make the killed player lose bounty), even if all moves are used during the fight and are not spammed.

T-Rex, along with Dragon and Gas, are the only unawakenable Blox Fruits that have unique transformation names ([V] Reptilian Scales for T-Rex and [V] Imperial Evolution for Dragon and [V] Vapour Condensation for Gas ).

T-Rex has a glitch that allows to go through the sea in transformation by using [C] Hunter's Rage skill while aiming down in the water, though they will die instantly. The user will keep falling through the map if they have Shark race and teleport back at the spawn point of the last island they stepped on.
If the opponent stays at the edge of T-Rex's [X] move, they could walk out of it as they are not fully stunned.

The in-game T-Rex's design bears resemblance to transformed Dragon's western variant, due to the curved, backwards facing horns on both their heads. Their relation is further implied by the fact that both T-Rex and Dragon are linked to the Prehistoric Island.

fruits.name: Mammoth
fruits.description: Mammoth transformation with charge attacks.
fruits.wiki_description: Mammoth transformation with charge attacks.
fruits.page_description: Mammoth is a Mythical Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   2,700,000 or   2,350 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
