trivia: The impact from jumping works the opposite way from Awakened Buddha. Buddha's jump damage applies on the initial jump from the ground, as for Mammoth, it applies on its landing. The impact from jumping can reset air jumps. This can be useful in evading water for players not of the Shark race by touching the surface of the water to reset air jumps while taking little to no damage.
The silhouette of its beast form can be seen when using its untransformed skills (excluding the [V] move).
The [X] move on Twin Hooks, Prehistoric Punt, parallels the [X] move on Mammoth, True Prehistoric Punt.

If the player pairs Bear Ears and Shark race with Mammoth, their damage reduction will be increased from 50 to about 70%. With Water Body, the player's damage reduction will increase from about 70% to about 80% due to Water Body boosting their defense by 65% for 4.5 seconds. (Recommended to get Race Awakening due to Shark V3 being heavily nerfed)

If the player pairs Bear Ears and Cyborg race (V2 and above) with Mammoth, its passive damage reduction will be raised from 55% to about 62% for any attack, and for attacks by Melee, Sword or Gun the player will have 85.5%. With the [T] ability active, the player will have ~69% in any attack and for attacks by Melee, Sword and Gun the player will have ~72%.

Mammoth is one of three pairs of fruits to share the same monetary value. The other two pairs are Control and Gas at   3,200,000 or   2,500, Yeti and Leopard at   5,000,000 or   3000.
(Shared with T-Rex at   2,700,000 or   2,350)
(Shared with T-Rex at   2,700,000 or   2,350)
Mammoth is the third fruit that doesn't need a Fury Meter to transform. (The first being Phoenix, second being Leopard, fourth being Yeti)

When getting hit by a move that has a grabbing animation while transformed, such as Dragon [X], the user will fly in weird ways that should be normal when at the size of a regular player, making it look comical in some sorts.

fruits.name: Celestial
fruits.description: Celestial powers, introduced in recent updates.
fruits.wiki_description: Celestial powers, introduced in recent updates.

fruits.name: Creation
fruits.description: Creation and manipulation abilities.
fruits.wiki_description: Creation and manipulation abilities.
fruits.page_description: Creation (formerly known as Barrier) is a Legendary Natural-type Blox Fruit that costs   1,400,000 or   1,750 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: Creation is the fourth fruit to get a rarity change, the first being Portal, second being Love, and third being Ghost.
Creation has the lowest Mastery requirements to get all the moves in the Legendary rarity.

When the physical Creation fruit breaks apart during its animation, the broken pieces will fall to a nearby surface. If the player teleports while holding out the fruit, the pieces will teleport back to within the vicinity of the fruit.
Creation is the first fruit to gain a different moveset, via Build Mode, without being awakened or transformed.
If the user leaves the server, all the buildings they have created will vanish.

Interestingly, allied players can just walk through the towers from [V] Magic City, instead of teleporting or being bounced back.
This may have been a balancing feature to make the towers not so obstructing for allies that are trying to help.
This may have been a balancing feature to make the towers not so obstructing for allies that are trying to help.
Creation is the only fruit with abilities that specialize in blocking attacks, which makes it extremely unique.
When used on a physical fruit, [V] Magic City will move the fruit away from its original location.

Creation's held M1 cannot be used on mobile normally. Instead, there is an alternative button located above [Z] Batter Up that functions just the same as tapping, although resembles an activation of a move instead. This feature is also present in Gravity, although it's held M1 can be used normally.

fruits.name: Eagle
fruits.description: Eagle transformation with enhanced mobility.
fruits.wiki_description: Eagle transformation with enhanced mobility.
fruits.page_description: Eagle (formerly known as Falcon) is an Uncommon Beast-type Blox Fruit that costs   550,000 or   975 from the Blox Fruit Dealer.
trivia: A physical Eagle Fruit can be obtained from defeating the Tyrant of the Skies at a relatively low chance.
Eagle is one of the four fruits that can be upgraded in the Admin Panel, the other being Gravity, Lightning, and Pain.
Eagle is the first Uncommon fruit to have a meter.
Eagle is also the only Uncommon beast fruit.
Eagle is one of the only fruits to have a skin, and the first uncommon to have one.
Eagle is the only Beast-type fruit that does not have a full transformation.
The physical eagle fruit is the smallest fruit model, this might be because the particle effects would cause lag when put at the scale of a regular fruit size.
Eagle is the only fruit that cost the same amount of money as a removed fruit in the game, Revive fruit. (Old Ghost fruit)

Parrot and Falcon skins are the only skins that do not actually depict a variation of Eagle, but rather another species of bird.
Falcon is a reference to the Falcon fruit, while Parrot was a chromatic concept for Falcon that the developers decided to add to the game as an Eagle skin.
Falcon is a reference to the Falcon fruit, while Parrot was a chromatic concept for Falcon that the developers decided to add to the game as an Eagle skin.
Eagle is the third fruit whose [F] ability requires the highest mastery, the first one being Rocket and the second being Blade.
Eagle's [F] Flight animation and sound are similar to awakened Phoenix [V] Full Transformation, as both make the scream of a Red-tailed hawk and spin in the air.
Eagle's feathers are similar to the Angel V3 particle effects.
Eagle is the only fruit which makes another accessory disappear (being Angel's wings, also for cyborg v4 wings ).

A real life bald eagle typically cruise at around 13.5 meters per second, and soar at speeds up to 45 meters per second. The in-game counterpart, however, flies at 10 meters per second with first upgrade or higher, and approximately 40-44 meters per second when lunging forwards with [V] Soaring Talon or upgraded [F] Flight (held).
Despite being one of the fastest flying creatures in the real world, Eagle's speed is considered slow in a universe where everything else has magical powers.
Keep in mind that an Eagle user is generally larger than an average bald eagle, decreasing the speed to body length ratio of an eagle user.
Body length to speed ratio means the top speed of an animal versus the size of the animal. For example, a transformed West Dragon flies at absurdly high speeds because it happens to be quite huge, maintaining the fair body length to speed ratio. However, a transformed Phoenix flies slightly faster than Eagle, despite being roughly the same size. This meant that Eagle has a slightly lower body length to speed ratio, making Eagle appear slow.
Despite being one of the fastest flying creatures in the real world, Eagle's speed is considered slow in a universe where everything else has magical powers.

Keep in mind that an Eagle user is generally larger than an average bald eagle, decreasing the speed to body length ratio of an eagle user.
Body length to speed ratio means the top speed of an animal versus the size of the animal. For example, a transformed West Dragon flies at absurdly high speeds because it happens to be quite huge, maintaining the fair body length to speed ratio. However, a transformed Phoenix flies slightly faster than Eagle, despite being roughly the same size. This meant that Eagle has a slightly lower body length to speed ratio, making Eagle appear slow.

Body length to speed ratio means the top speed of an animal versus the size of the animal. For example, a transformed West Dragon flies at absurdly high speeds because it happens to be quite huge, maintaining the fair body length to speed ratio. However, a transformed Phoenix flies slightly faster than Eagle, despite being roughly the same size. This meant that Eagle has a slightly lower body length to speed ratio, making Eagle appear slow.

fightingStyles.name: Combat
fightingStyles.page_description: It is recommended to buy another fighting style such as Dark Step, Electric, or Water Kung Fu quickly as combat is generally deemed to be very bad for grinding and PvP. Compared to the available fighting style options in the First Sea, Combat is generally extremely weak.
trivia: Combat is by far the most realistic fighting style in-game as it is the only one that does not use attacks out of magical elements such as fire, water, magic and electricity.
Combat is considered the rarest thing in the game, as once the user changes their fighting style they cannot get it back.
Combat is the only fighting style that only has two moves.
Combat is the only fighting style without an icon, and it is simply presented as "Combat".

Combat is the only fighting style that cannot be learned back after using another fighting style.
Combat can only be learned again through admin commands.
Combat can only be learned again through admin commands.
Combat has the second slowest M1s, Dark Step having the slowest.
Combat's moves are similar to the [C] and [X] moves of Superhuman and Godhuman.
Most Enemies use the M1 of Combat.
Raiders use the [M1] and the [Z] move of Combat.
Combat has the most realistic idle stance of all Fighting Styles, as it resembles a real-life boxing guard.

[Z] Quick Tackle cannot hit normal sized NPCs and players on the ground while using unawakened and awakened Buddha's transformation. This is because Buddha's hitbox is above the ground, and as [Z] Quick Tackle cannot be aimed vertically and [X] Ground Smash has a small hitbox, only the M1s can be used while transformed.

fightingStyles.name: Dark Step
fightingStyles.page_description: If the player activates Aura while Dark Step is equipped, the Aura will appear on the player's legs instead of their arms. This is entirely visual and provides no additional buffs compared to Aura on the arms in the same stage.
trivia: Dark Step is considered to be the best fighting style for grinding aura mastery.
If the user uses [V] Overheat and goes into Light's [F] Light Flight, the flames will get all messed up.

If [V] Overheat is used over 100 times, the user will have both legs on fire upon using it again, similar to Death Step's [V] move which doesn't have a requirement for both legs to be on fire and has it from the start upon use.

If the user uses [V] Overheat, and then switches to another fighting style, the user's legs will still be on fire without an expiration timer. Hence, it is possible to get both flame legs and flame fists by activating the move and equipping Dragon Talon. This effect only gets removed if the player dies or rejoins, and it is purely cosmetic if they switch to another fighting style. The expiration timer is however restored if using the [V] move again.
The damage multiplier is only applied while using Dark Step or Death Step's moves, so the user cannot use this to get extra damage on other moves.
If the player has Dark Step or Death Step equipped, their Aura stages will start at their legs, instead of their hands.
[C] Barrage is similar to Rubber's [C] Rush.
If the user uses [C] Barrage and quickly switch fighting styles while holding it, they will be stuck in the animation.
Dark Step is the one of the only two fighting styles to have four moves, the other being its successor, Death Step.
In Update 9 Dark Step was almost renamed to Fire Feet.
By equipping Death Step/Dark Step and climbing to a ladder, the user will climb with their legs instead of their hands, due to the user's hands being on their waist.
Dark Step is chronologically the first fighting style that the player can purchase.

Similar to Death Step, Dark Step's [V] Overheat can permanently be activated by using Ghoul V3 to ignore 40% of the final cooldown time. However, for Death Step, the user needs to wait until the move expires, otherwise it will only disable the flames and they will need to wait longer to be able to use it again.

fightingStyles.name: Electric
fightingStyles.page_description: Electric can be great for beginners as it can do some fairly decent damage and also stun enemies. All of the moves are AoE so that beginners can grind enemies, by grouping them up easily and hit them at once.
trivia: Due to having electrical properties, Electric cannot harm Rubber users due to Rubber being immune to electricity.
While Electric is equipped, the user's hands will be covered in electricity, though this is purely cosmetic.

fightingStyles.name: Water Kung Fu
fightingStyles.page_description: Water Kung Fu is considered by many as one of best fighting styles for grinding because the M1s are very fast and does not cause the user to dash. (Unlike its upgrade Sharkman Karate)
trivia: Water Kung Fu is the most expensive fighting style in the First Sea.
The unreworked version of [X] Deadly Shower is used by Sea Beasts.

fightingStyles.name: Dragon Breath
fightingStyles.page_description: Dragon Breath is considered relatively weak by many players. However, it can be evolved to Dragon Talon, making it a lot stronger.
trivia:
Dragon Breath is the cheapest fighting style that costs Fragments  .
Dragon Breath is also the only fighting style that does not require Money   to purchase.
Dragon Breath is also the only fighting style that does not require Money   to purchase.

Usually, when equipping a fighting style, the system message displays: 'Bought <Fighting Style> for   0 and  0'. However, when equipping Dragon Breath, the message instead reads: 'Activated <Dragon Breath>.'

fightingStyles.name: Superhuman
fightingStyles.description: Combination of basic styles for super speed.
fightingStyles.wiki_description: Combination of basic styles for super speed.
fightingStyles.page_description: Superhuman is a long-standing fighting style in PvP due to its simple and agile moves. Because of its flexible mobility, this fighting style was extremely popular. Now, it's less popular because of the newer and better fighting styles such as Dragon Talon, Electric Claw, and its successor, Godhuman. This can still be used to practice skills. This fighting style is mostly used in skilled builds.
trivia: If the user hits an NPC using [C] Conqueror Gun on the hot side of Hot and Cold, the user will take damage because of the lava underneath.
Superhuman is used by the Living Zombies at Haunted Castle, but they only utilize M1s (left clicks) and not the moves.
Even though Superhuman is the most expensive V1 fighting style, and others are better due to factors such as damage or range, this still is a decent fighting style to use.
Superhuman is said to be Combat's successor, although it was proven false after the announcement of "Superhuman V2" (Godhuman) by rip_indra.

Superhuman is basically a weaker version of Godhuman because both fighting styles have similar moves with Superhuman. This fighting style simply has older, more outdated design, slightly lower damage and [X] Thunder Clap not containing two variants compared to its successor, Godhuman.
Superhuman can be good for grinding aura since [Z] Beast Owl Pounce deals a decent amount of hits.
Superhuman is the fighting style with the second highest mastery requiring obtainment, with all other fighting styles (except Godhuman) being tied to each other in the mastery requirements.
Superhuman isn't very good for grinding or PvP compared to the V2s, so it is recommended to use a different fighting style, such as its upgraded version, Godhuman.
This is (sometimes) regarded as the 'most skilled fighting style' in the game.

fightingStyles.name: Death Step
fightingStyles.description: Advanced Dark Step with death themes.
fightingStyles.wiki_description: Advanced Dark Step with death themes.
fightingStyles.page_description: Death Step is the upgraded version of Dark Step, making it significantly more powerful in many aspects. While this Fighting Style is equipped, Aura stages are based on the user's legs instead of their arms while activated. This is entirely visual and provides no buffs apart from regular Aura buffs.
trivia: Death Step and its inferior version Dark Step are the only current fighting styles in the whole game that have a transformation-type move that enhances damage, as well as the only ones that have four moves.

There is a bug where if [V] Maximum Overheat is active while switching fighting styles, the visual effect on the user's feet will stay until the user dies or leaves the game. This also applies to Dark Step. Keep in mind that this is purely visual effect, and does not provide any buffs.
When using [Z] Rocket Kick on the edges of the volcano at the Magma Village, the crater created will be purple, similar to T-Rex's [F] move.

The [V] ability Maximum Overheat has the highest mastery required for a move in the whole game, being 400 mastery, with other [V] moves usually having mastery requirements of 150, 225, 250, 300, 350 mastery. However, Maximum Overheat before Update 14 used to have a mastery requirement of 450.

Before Update 14, Death Step's [V] was one of the most tedious things to get in the game, with things like Godhuman, Sanguine Art, Race Awakenings and others, did not exist at the time, so getting this move was one of the most tedious things to do at the time, similar to getting max level, 30m Bounty/Honor, getting 600 mastery on something, owning the most expensive fruits, and others. But when Update 14 rolled around, the mastery requirement went from 450 to 400.
Death Step, along with Dark Step, are the only fighting styles that have [V] abilities.
Death Step's [V] move used to be called Devil Flames.

fightingStyles.name: Sharkman Karate
fightingStyles.description: Advanced Water Kung Fu with shark power.
fightingStyles.wiki_description: Advanced Water Kung Fu with shark power.
fightingStyles.page_description: Sharkman Karate serves as an upgrade to its First Sea counterpart Water Kung Fu. It is an excellent fighting style for combos mainly because its moves are faster, easy to hit, and deal much more damage compared to Water Kung Fu, as well as most of its moves breaking instinct.
trivia: Both Kilo Admiral and Fish Crew Member uses Sharkman Karate Old's M1's as its melee.
Sharkman Karate is considerably the best way to grind for Aura levels, as almost all the moves are tick damage, especially [C] Great Sea Spear as it has lots of tick damage.
Sharkman Karate is the second V2 Fighting Style to have an upgraded version, the first being Dragon Talon.
Before Update 27.3, Sharkman Karate was obtained from Daigrock, the Sharkman.

Despite being an upgrade to Water Kung Fu, Sharkman Karate currently stands as the fighting style with the worst m1s in-game, due to their overall bad hitbox and dash on 3rd M1 causing many people to hate the rework. It is recommended to use Sharkman Karate solely for pvp, and Water Kung Fu for grinding.

Currently, the Sharkman Master's final belt in the Fish slap battle training is excruciatingly hard, as it requires a 100% critical hit ratio, and getting lucky so the Sharkman Master misses his final hit.

fightingStyles.name: Electric Claw
fightingStyles.page_description: Electric Claw serves as an upgraded version to its predecessor, Electric. It is mainly used for PvP due to its quick speed and moderately easy-to-hit, powerful, and stunning skills. Although it is highly not recommended for aerial PvP, since its moves are mainly on the ground.
trivia: Somehow, the damage dealt to Sea Beasts with [Z] Electric Rampage is measly. (Probably because only the final slashes are counted as physical attacks, and it deals most of damage)

The player can use Flash Step while triggering [Z] Electric Rampage or [C] Thunderclap and Flash (only for mobile users) by pressing Flash Step first, then pressing "Use" [C] Thunderclap and Flash. This can be used for surprising enemies.

Players can turn Electric Claw's M1's to something useful. Using an auto clicker and setting the click interval to one millisecond, players can glide because the M1's of this fighting style has a short dash. This is similar to Dragon Talon.
If the player turns on the damage counter before using [X] Lightning Thrust, the damage counter will say 0 damage before it creates the explosion.
If [X] Lightning Thrust is held down long enough, (approximately 30 seconds) the electrical effects and sound will stop but nothing else changes.
[X] Lightning Thrust can sometimes launch the user very far away if they have a low-end PC or high ping, making it great for traveling and running.
Sometimes, [X] Lightning Thrust can glitch the user under an island and into the water in raids. (Usually when their ping is high.)
[C] Thunderclap and Flash sometimes glitches the user into the sea, killing them. The reason is unknown.
[C] Thunderclap and Flash can glitch the user under islands like Tiki Outpost and Sea of Treats.
The [X] Lighting Thrust move is the same sound as when Piranhas use their shocks.
The Electric Claw is the only Fighting Style that has a model just like Guns and Swords.
With enough lag, [Z] Electric Rampage cannot teleport the user.

fightingStyles.name: Dragon Talon
fightingStyles.description: Advanced Dragon Breath with talon strikes.
fightingStyles.wiki_description: Advanced Dragon Breath with talon strikes.
fightingStyles.page_description: Dragon Talon serves as a direct upgrade from Dragon Breath, with attacks that resemble Dragon's abilities—hence the name. It focuses on close-range, high-damage, area-filled combat, utilizing burning effects and distorting the opponent’s view with violent screen shakes. However, in return, it is generally slower than most other fighting styles. Dragon Talon is mostly used for grinding or Sea Events due to its high damage and AoE moves.
moves: hence the name. It focuses on close-range
distorting the opponent’s view with violent screen shakes. However
it is generally slower than most other fighting styles. Dragon Talon is mostly used for grinding or Sea Events due to its high damage
trivia: Dragon Talon is the fighting style with the highest M1 damage in the game.
The sound of Dragon Talon's [Z] move when it misses is the same as the sound of the Yama [Z] move when it misses.
Dragon Talon's M1 sound effects originated from Dragon Breath's fire-based M1s, it being a predecessor to this fighting style.

Many people think Dragon Talon's [Z] move is the only move in the game with a finisher variant, although this is actually wrong. Shadow's [C] Nightmare Leech also has a finisher variant, and the reason people don't notice is because the finisher only slightly changes the move.

The finisher variant of [Z] Talon Lighter is a guaranteed kill—bypassing all forms of resurrection (like Ghost's and Pain's Resurrection passives, but also Friendly PvP's revive), defense (like Shark V3 and Cyborg V3), healing (like Phoenix's [X] and Angel V3), and instinct-tricking.
Dragon Talon's M1s release a mark that looks like a dragon's footprint.
When the user uses [Z] Talon Lighter, they will see a faint image of a dragon head as they dash.
When the user uses [X]Ember Annihilation at a thin wall like the Ice Castle's wall, they will have a slight chance of phasing through the wall.
[C] Infernal Vortex resembles Transformed Eastern Dragon's [X], as the user holds the enemy in place, jumps up, then slams down with devastating force.
Dragon Talon is the first V2 Fighting Style to be able to be upgraded, followed by Sharkman Karate.

fightingStyles.name: Godhuman
fightingStyles.page_description: Godhuman is one of the best fighting styles in PvP due to its impressive speed, damage, knockback, and stun. However, it is not ideal for grinding because of its slow [M1] attack speed and lack of effective AoE moves. Additionally, its knockback is a disadvantage when grinding, as it makes grouping enemies more difficult.
trivia: Godhuman costs   5,000,000,   5,000, and will cost   20,400,000,   26,500 and 3,600 combined masteries from 400 each on all Fighting Styles except Combat and Sanguine Art.
Godhuman is the only fighting style to have 2 moves with tap/held variants, with them being [X] Heaven and Earth and [C] Sixth Realm Gun.
Godhuman is considered the most tedious Fighting Style to obtain to most players, due to it requiring almost every fighting style in the game at 400 mastery along with the hard-to-obtain materials.
Godhuman's [TAP] Normal Attack leaves a rainbow trail for a split second, just like how Instinct V2 leaves a trail when enabled.
Like Superhuman, the M1s make a shockwave of compressed air and have a small trail behind when used, Godhuman's being more prominent.

[Z] Soaring Beast and [C] Sixth Realm Gun will cause the player to take water damage if their target is below water, so be wary. (Unless the player is using the Shark race or the user is not using a Blox Fruit.)
[Z] Soaring Beast and [C] Sixth Realm Gun can allow the player to grab an enemy through a thin wall if their target is close to the wall.
Godhuman is commonly abbreviated as 'GH'.
Godhuman is a very versatile and popular fighting style for bounty hunting, and many people use it.

Godhuman's [Z] Soaring Beast and [C] Sixth Realm Gun tap variants (as Godhuman's [C] Sixth Realm Gun (held) breaks Instinct) themselves are easily "instinct-trickable". It is recommended to use an ability to break or wear off Instinct beforehand, like Cyborg's V3 or Godhuman's [X] Heaven and Earth.

fightingStyles.name: Sanguine Art
fightingStyles.page_description: Sanguine Art's life leech, decently easy-to-hit moves, and immense combo potential make it one of the best fighting styles for general use, with its main competitors being Godhuman, Electric Claw, and Dragon Talon.
trivia: The first part of the name "Sanguine Art" comes from the Latin word for blood, sanguis.

Sanguine Art is the first fighting style to have a life-stealing move. ([Z] move - Bloodbane Drain)
Likewise, the bats can damage large objects (Such as Sea Beasts), but it does not restore the user's health or grab.
Additionally, this move features aim assist that enables the user to grab enemies within the attack path directly ahead, provided they are at a close enough distance. This effectively extends the range for grabbing enemies to approximately 1.6 times farther along the straight line in front of the move.
Likewise, the bats can damage large objects (Such as Sea Beasts), but it does not restore the user's health or grab.

Additionally, this move features aim assist that enables the user to grab enemies within the attack path directly ahead, provided they are at a close enough distance. This effectively extends the range for grabbing enemies to approximately 1.6 times farther along the straight line in front of the move.

The [C] move is a multi-target move, meaning it can grab multiple targets at the same time if directly used.
Even if it misses, it can still track multiple enemies.
Even if it misses, it can still track multiple enemies.
Sanguine Art is the fighting style with the fastest M1 speed.
Sanguine Art is the fighting style with the highest [C] move damage in the game.
The player is not required to have mastery on any other fighting style to learn Sanguine Art. It is possible to learn even if the user is still using Combat.
Haunted Crew Member and the Red Commander the only enemy in the game that uses this fighting style
If combining Skull Guitar's [X] move, Ghoul Mask, Ghoul V4 Blood Siphon (tier 2), night time, and using the [Z] move, the player's life-leech can reach ~47-50%.
Sanguine Art, alongside Combat, are the only fighting styles without an upgraded version of them.
If the player has a Leviathan Heart and interact with Shafi, their materials (if they have them) will be consumed automatically, even if they didn't wish to.
There is a glitch where after using [C] Devourer of Worlds, the user will be stuck in the move stance. This can be undone by using the [C] move again.

swords.name: Katana
swords.description: Basic steel katana for beginners. Abilities: Quiet Rush, Air Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Basic steel katana for beginners. Abilities: Quiet Rush, Air Slash.
swords.page_description: The Katana can be purchased for   1,000 from the Sword Dealer.
trivia: The Katana used to have a price of   5,000 instead of   1,000.

The Katana is functionally identical to the Cutlass, sharing the same moveset, damage values, and cooldowns even though granted, they are different swords. The only distinction between the two weapons is their model design.
The Katana and Cutlass are the first obtainable swords a normal player can get.
The Katana has a bug, when you use [Z] Quiet Rush and quickly unequip it, it wil cause the user being in a weird animation.

swords.name: Cutlass
swords.description: Short, curved sword for sailors. Abilities: Quiet Rush, Air Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Short, curved sword for sailors. Abilities: Quiet Rush, Air Slash.
swords.page_description: The Cutlass can be purchased for   1,000 from the Sword Dealer.
trivia: The Cutlass has the same move set as the Katana.
The Cutlass used to cost   5,000 instead of   1,000.
Chef and many other enemies use the Cutlass.
Prior to Chef using the Cutlass, Bobby used to use it. Chef replaced Bobby as of Update 26.
The Cutlass also appears as the 2x Mastery icon in the shop.

swords.name: Dual Katana
swords.description: Dual-wield katanas for fast slashes. Abilities: Cyclone Slash, Double Air Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Dual-wield katanas for fast slashes. Abilities: Cyclone Slash, Double Air Slash.
swords.page_description: The Dual Katana is a Common sword.
trivia: The Dual Katana is often preferred over the Iron Mace because of its wider area of effect, making it more effective against multiple enemies.

swords.name: Iron Mace
swords.description: Heavy mace for crushing attacks. Abilities: Crush, Ground Slam.
swords.wiki_description: Heavy mace for crushing attacks. Abilities: Crush, Ground Slam.
swords.page_description: The Iron Mace is an Uncommon sword.
trivia: The Iron Mace is the only sword that has visible spikes on it.

When the player holds [X] Killer Combo then rapidly unequips the Iron Mace right before the move finishes its animation, they will be rendered immobile until the player resets or leaves the game. This glitch can be useful for AFK grinding enemies by preventing the player from moving or perhaps taking knockback from attacks. (This can prove useful for lower leveled players with Elemental fruits, but doesn't really help that much with general grinding.)
The Iron Mace, despite being classified as a sword, is a Mace.
The Iron Mace, alongside Shark Saw and Bisento are the only swords that slam on the ground on the last M1.

swords.name: Shark Saw
swords.description: Serrated blade from shark teeth. Abilities: Shark Bite, Frenzy Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Serrated blade from shark teeth. Abilities: Shark Bite, Frenzy Slash.
swords.page_description: The Shark Saw is an Uncommon sword.
trivia: The Shark Saw, alongside Iron Mace and Bisento are the only swords that slam on the ground on the last M1.
Fishman Raiders use the Shark Saw with the old version of [X] Execution.

swords.name: Triple Katana
swords.description: Three katanas for versatile attacks. Abilities: Triple Slash, Spinning Blades.
swords.wiki_description: Three katanas for versatile attacks. Abilities: Triple Slash, Spinning Blades.
swords.page_description: The Triple Katana is an Uncommon sword.
trivia: The Vice Admiral, Fishman Commandos, Marine Captains, and Cake Guards use the Triple Katana as their weapon.
The Triple Katana is one of the only three Swords in the game that have three Swords combined to form one. (Triple Katana, True Triple Katana and Triple Dark Blade).

swords.name: Dual-Headed Blade
swords.description: Double-ended blade for unique combos. Abilities: Double Slash, Spinning Strike.
swords.wiki_description: Double-ended blade for unique combos. Abilities: Double Slash, Spinning Strike.
swords.page_description: The Dual-Headed Blade is a Rare sword.
trivia: In the moveset, the Dual-Headed Blade is called "Headed Blade" (due to the lack of wording space).
The X move appears to be an upgraded version of the Wardens Sword X move.
The Dual-Headed Blade is the third most expensive sword in the First Sea behind Soul Cane and Bisento.

swords.name: Pipe
swords.description: Metal pipe for blunt attacks. Abilities: Pipe Smash, Heavy Swing.
swords.wiki_description: Metal pipe for blunt attacks. Abilities: Pipe Smash, Heavy Swing.
swords.page_description: The Pipe can be bought at the cost of   100,000 from the Sword Dealer of the East, who is located at the Frozen Village in the First Sea.
trivia: Even though the Pipe is a sword, its shape and name have no sword-like characteristics at all.
[X] Earth Smash (old move) was similar to Iron Mace's [X] ability.

The Pipe's model prior to Update 24 was an actual pipe. The name for the weapon after the update had remained unchanged which makes the item description make no sense, despite its updated appearance. This can be confusing for new players who are unfamiliar with the old Pipe model.

swords.name: Soul Cane
swords.description: Mystic cane harnessing souls. Abilities: Soul Beam, Soul Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Mystic cane harnessing souls. Abilities: Soul Beam, Soul Slash.
swords.page_description: The Soul Cane can be bought for   750,000 from the Living Skeleton. It is recommended to use Fast Mode due to the entrance being hard to spot.
trivia: The Soul Cane is well known because of its combo potential and good stuns. However, it is hard to use due to small hitboxes, which is why this sword is mostly seen in skill builds, usually paired with Acidum Rifle and others.
Even though it is thought to be for low level players, it is still good in PvP.
The Soul Cane is the second most expensive sword in the First Sea, the first being Bisento.
The way Soul Cane is held is known as the "reverse grip" (in real life combat), which is often not practiced due to the technique lacking range, protection and power in ranged combat.
The way soul cane is held is the exact same as the Gravity Blade.

swords.name: Trident
swords.description: Long spear for piercing attacks. Abilities: Pierce, Trident Throw.
swords.wiki_description: Long spear for piercing attacks. Abilities: Pierce, Trident Throw.
swords.page_description: The Trident can be obtained after defeating the Fishman Lord.

swords.name: Warden Sword
swords.description: Balanced sword for PvE. Abilities: Warden Slash, Guard Break.
swords.wiki_description: Balanced sword for PvE. Abilities: Warden Slash, Guard Break.
swords.page_description: Redirect to:

swords.name: Bisento
swords.description: Large pole weapon for sweeping attacks. Abilities: Quake Smash, Tornado Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Large pole weapon for sweeping attacks. Abilities: Quake Smash, Tornado Slash.
swords.page_description: To obtain the Bisento, the player must buy it from the Master Sword Dealer, who is located on the fourth island at Skylands. The player can buy this sword for   1,000,000 only if the player is at least Lv. 250.
trivia: Bisento has one of Quake's old abilities (Quake Sphere) as one of its moves.
This sword has the second highest damage per click in the game. (The first being Triple Dark Blade and third is True Triple Katana.)
Bisento, Dark Blade, Katana, and Cutlass received an animation update in Update 17.2.
Bisento is the most expensive sword in the First Sea.
Bisento, Dark Blade, Saber, and Pole are the only four swords to have a V2.
Before Update 24, if the player activated an auto-clicker right as the impact effect appeared, there was a chance the sword would have double its range.
Bisento V2’s [Z] move is similar to Mammoth [Z] but smaller.
For some reason, the fourth M1 doesn't work in Buddha transformation.

swords.name: Pole (1st Form)
swords.description: Staff weapon with electric charge. Abilities: Thunder Strike, Pole Vault.
swords.wiki_description: Staff weapon with electric charge. Abilities: Thunder Strike, Pole Vault.
swords.page_description: The Pole (1st Form) is a Legendary sword.
trivia: The Pole (1st Form) can be upgraded to its second form (Pole (2nd Form)) by getting struck by a lightning in Rough Sea while holding Pole (1st Form).
The inventory description states the Sword is blunt, but due to the revamped model, it appears sharp, like a spear.

swords.name: Saber
swords.description: Dropped by Saber Expert; upgradable. Abilities: Flying Slash, Triple Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by Saber Expert; upgradable. Abilities: Flying Slash, Triple Slash.
swords.page_description: The Saber is a Legendary sword.
trivia: While the Saber can be great for PvP, it can only really work if the opponent is not using Instinct. Since this sword does not have any abilities that break Instinct, it is suggested to have another weapon equipped that can break Instinct easily.
It is recommended to bounty hunt with Ice or Dark along with the Saber, as the player can pull enemies with Dark's [X] ability to the critical [Z] ability range.

The player should aim accurately to deal a critical hit on their opponent. (V2)
It is possible to do a one-shot combo using just the Last Resort ability along with the [Z] and [X] abilities, if done right.
It is possible to do a one-shot combo using just the Last Resort ability along with the [Z] and [X] abilities, if done right.

Due to its incredible damage, the Saber V2 is still considered to be a fairly decent sword in PvP in the Second Sea. However, it is recommended that the player upgrades to a better sword as they progress out of the Second Sea and enter the Third Sea.
The Saber is one of the best swords the player can obtain in the First Sea.
The Saber is one of the best swords for grinding, as its M1 deals high damage, with little to no knockback, and has a low cooldown.
The Saber's handguard model cuts into the hilt.
[Z] Deadly Rush is a good combo extender so always try to combo with that (for low level).
The Saber has the fastest one-shot combo, being one second to eliminate an enemy if pairing it with Godhuman and Portal, and using the right combo.
The Saber is required to obtain Instinct.
Saber Expert uses the old moves of Saber.

The [Z] Deadly Rush ability (V1 or V2) can be used to go through thin walls, such as the igloos at the cold side of Hot and Cold. The user needs to get close to the igloo entrance, but don't touch the wall, then use the [Z] Deadly Rush ability forwards to the wall.
The Saber, along with Bisento, Dark Blade and Pole (1st Form) are the only swords with a V2.

swords.name: Dragon Trident
swords.description: Fire-based trident with range. Abilities: Dragon Pierce, Flame Burst.
swords.wiki_description: Fire-based trident with range. Abilities: Dragon Pierce, Flame Burst.
swords.page_description: The Dragon Trident is a Rare sword.
trivia: If the player uses the Dragon Trident's [M1] dash attack in mid-air, they will go very far.
The Tide Keeper uses the old abilities of Dragon Trident.
The Dragon Trident is the only Rare sword to have its [X] move mastery requirement being 350.

swords.name: Gravity Blade
swords.description: Dropped by Fajita; gravity effects. Abilities: Gravity Push, Meteor Strike.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by Fajita; gravity effects. Abilities: Gravity Push, Meteor Strike.
swords.page_description: The Gravity Blade (formerly known as Gravity Cane) is a Rare sword.
trivia:
Gravity Blade is based on the Chokutō, which is a traditional Japanese sword.
In real life, the way this sword is held is known as the "reverse grip". While this grip reduces the power and precision of attacks, it allows for quicker and less predictable movements in close quarters, making it ideal for surprise strikes.

In real life, the way this sword is held is known as the "reverse grip". While this grip reduces the power and precision of attacks, it allows for quicker and less predictable movements in close quarters, making it ideal for surprise strikes.
[X] Lunar Blitz is quite similar to Awakened Dough's grounded [X] Pastry River, with both sharing a lift-and-drop mechanic.
Gravity Blade's old [Z] (Gravity Push) was identical to Gravity's old [Z], with both sharing names, VFX and move purpose. (Other than the direction of the move.)
Gravity Blade's old moves were similar to Orbitus' moves with the [Z] being the same as one of his moves and the [X] being a shorter version of his other move.

swords.name: Flail
swords.description: Dropped by bosses; chain-based. Abilities: Chain Whip, Spiked Slam.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by bosses; chain-based. Abilities: Chain Whip, Spiked Slam.
swords.page_description: The Flail (formerly known as Jitte) is a Rare sword.
trivia: The Flail is used by the Lv. 1150 Boss, Smoke Admiral and a Lv. 2600 Raid Boss, Tyrant of the Skies.
The Flail is the only weapon used by two bosses, but only dropped by one.

A special glitch can be done with the Flail to make it look like the player is using /opfun, an admin command which allows a player to spam abilities even when they are still doing the ability. (Maybe patched)
Flail is not a typical sword but actually a spin-off of Morning Star, it was typically used by the cavalry in the medieval times.

swords.name: Longsword
swords.description: Dropped by bosses; long reach. Abilities: Long Slash, Piercing Thrust.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by bosses; long reach. Abilities: Long Slash, Piercing Thrust.
swords.page_description: The Longsword can be obtained after defeating the Diamond boss.
trivia: Despite the description saying that the Longsword has a hexagonal cross-section, the older model used to look like a pentagon.

swords.name: Koko
swords.description: Buffed by Control fruit; high AoE. Abilities: Electric Slash, Thunderous Strike.
swords.wiki_description: Buffed by Control fruit; high AoE. Abilities: Electric Slash, Thunderous Strike.
swords.page_description: Koko can be dropped after defeating Order.
trivia: Koko isn’t seen much in builds, but it’s actually a really good sword for hybrids. Especially when paired with Control, where it gets heavily buffed, making it a versatile option.
Koko is used by the Lv. 1250 raid boss, Order.
Both moves deal the exact same damage.
Despite being called a katana, Koko itself is an ōdachi, which is longer and larger than a normal katana.
[Z] Electric Stab can be used to no-clip through thin walls and doors.
Koko is the first sword to be buffed by a fruit other than Buddha, which is Control.

The hitbox of [X] Injection Shot is at the player's cursor, not the visual, meaning if the player moves the cursor to somewhere else, then the move's hitbox will move as well. For instance, if the player first aimed the [X] Injection Shot in front of themselves but aimed to the right after releasing the move, the target(s) to the right will be affected. (Does not work if the player held the move instead of tapping the move.)

Koko is not curved like a normal ōdachi, instead it is straight. This suggests that after forging koko was not drenched in water, rather it was left to cool off, which ideally would result in a weaker katana.

swords.name: Midnight Blade
swords.description: Dropped by El Admin; night-themed. Abilities: Night Slash, Shadow Strike.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by El Admin; night-themed. Abilities: Night Slash, Shadow Strike.
swords.page_description: The Midnight Blade is a Legendary sword.
trivia: The old version of the Midnight Blade is used by the Lv. 1325 Raid Boss, Cursed Captain.
The afterimage that the [Z] move creates holds the unreleased redesign of the Midnight Blade.

swords.name: Rengoku
swords.description: Fiery blade with blazing strikes. Abilities: Burning Slash, Flame Burst.
swords.wiki_description: Fiery blade with blazing strikes. Abilities: Burning Slash, Flame Burst.
swords.page_description: Rengoku can be obtained by using the Hidden Key to unlock a chest at the Ice Castle, located in the Second Sea. The chest is hidden under the staircase, right below the Awakened Ice Admiral, the entrance of which can be found to the right.
trivia: Rengoku is an easter egg that the devs added at Update 13.
Before the rework in Update 20, the [Z] move did not do burn damage.
Rengoku's moveset post-rework is similar to the Pipe.

swords.name: Saishi
swords.description: Legendary sword from Dealer; gold-infused. Abilities: Swords Dance, True Air Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Legendary sword from Dealer; gold-infused. Abilities: Swords Dance, True Air Slash.
swords.page_description: Saishi (formerly known as Saddi) is a Legendary sword.
trivia: Saishi, along with Shizu and Oroshi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.
The user can grab Besto Friendos (Love's [V] move) with [Z] Swords Dance.
Saishi is debated to be the best sword in the Second Sea, with its main competitors being Rengoku, Dragon Trident, and Midnight Blade.
[Z] Swords Dance will lock the user in place for a second after dealing damage to big targets such as Sea Beasts.
[Z] Swords Dance and [X] True Air Slash deal the same amount of damage. (Only if [Z] is used close to the target)

swords.name: Shizu
swords.description: Legendary sword from Dealer; agile strikes. Abilities: Wind Slash, Cyclone Strike.
swords.wiki_description: Legendary sword from Dealer; agile strikes. Abilities: Wind Slash, Cyclone Strike.
swords.page_description: Shizu (formerly known as Shisui) is a Legendary sword.
trivia: Although Shizu is considered out meta by the community because of its bad hitbox and does not break Instinct, its combos are still extremely fast and the sword itself deals good damage.
Shizu, along with Oroshi and Saishi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.

Shizu is much like Canvander or Koko.
Many people refer to Shizu as an improved version of Cutlass and Katana.
Many people refer to Shizu as an improved version of Cutlass and Katana.

swords.name: Oroshi
swords.description: Legendary sword from Dealer; precise. Abilities: Swift Slash, Storm Blade.
swords.wiki_description: Legendary sword from Dealer; precise. Abilities: Swift Slash, Storm Blade.
swords.page_description: Oroshi (formerly known as Wando) is a Legendary sword.
trivia: Oroshi, along with Shizu and Saishi are required (and with 300 mastery on each respectively) to obtain the True Triple Katana.
Oroshi's pre-rework [X] move (Scatter Shot) was much similar to that of pre-rework Bisento's.
Oroshi is often used in skilled builds, together with Bizarre Revolver and Rumble.

[Z] Continuous Slashing is similar to both Spin's and Dark Blade's [Z] moves, although it is smaller and lasts longer.
[Z] Continuous Slashing had a larger hitbox before it was reworked.
[Z] Continuous Slashing had a larger hitbox before it was reworked.

swords.name: Tushita
swords.description: Dropped by Longma; celestial power. Abilities: Heavenly Slash, Starfall.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by Longma; celestial power. Abilities: Heavenly Slash, Starfall.
swords.page_description: Getting both Tushita and Yama to 350 mastery and being Lv. 2200 or higher will grant the player access to do the Cursed Dual Katana puzzle and allow them obtain Cursed Dual Katana once they have completed the puzzle.
trivia: Tushita is named after Tusita, one of the six deva-worlds of the Desire Realm in Buddhism.
"Tushita" cannot be said in Roblox chat. This is due to it having a swear word in it. This means that the player has to say an alternative such as "tusita".

swords.name: Yama
swords.description: Dropped by bosses; shockwave attacks. Abilities: Hell Slash, Demon Cut.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by bosses; shockwave attacks. Abilities: Hell Slash, Demon Cut.
swords.page_description: Yama is an excellent support sword in PvP. Its [Z] Hellish Slash can be used to ragdoll the user when performing the Skull Guitar boosting glitch, providing amazing mobility, especially when paired with Kitsune. Its [X] Infernal Hurricane has a good enough range to be useful in combos to connect to a projectile move, such as Kitsune's [C] Fox Fire Disruption.
trivia:
In Buddhism, Yama is the King of Hell, named after Yāma — the third of the six heavenly worlds in the desire realm.
The sword could also be named after the Yamadharma Raja (Yama in short), the god of death and justice in Hindu mythology.
The sword could also be named after the Yamadharma Raja (Yama in short), the god of death and justice in Hindu mythology.
Yama is one of the two cursed katanas, the other being Tushita. Together, they are capable of making the Cursed Dual Katana.
There is no level requirement to get Yama, unlike Tushita. However, the player will still need to be at least Lv. 1500 in order to get into the Third Sea, where it can be obtained.

It is recommended to grind Elite Pirates on a private server or server hop for them. This is because in public servers Elite Pirates can be easily killed before the player comes to their place by other players or some hackers because some scripts have the option “auto-farm elite.”
The player does not lose their Elite Hunter's progress upon failure to pull out Yama.

[Z] Hellish Slash can be used to glitch through walls.
Example: Using this move while aiming for the entrance of King Toad's House next to Awakenings Expert (in Second Sea) will glitch the user into the room.
Example: Using this move while aiming for the entrance of King Toad's House next to Awakenings Expert (in Second Sea) will glitch the user into the room.
When [X] Infernal Hurricane is used on top of the stairs that the Aura Editor is on, the user will glitch into an empty area.
Yama [X] can cause other players to get flung if they use a momentum skill into it.

swords.name: True Triple Katana
swords.description: Combines Saishi, Shizu, Oroshi; high damage. Abilities: Wolf Fang Rush, Dragon Hurricane.
swords.wiki_description: Combines Saishi, Shizu, Oroshi; high damage. Abilities: Wolf Fang Rush, Dragon Hurricane.
swords.page_description: The True Triple Katana is a Mythical sword.
trivia:
The True Triple Katana is often abbreviated as "TTK".
The abbreviation "TTK" cannot be said in Roblox chat, mainly due to it containing a sensitive word. Instead, the player can use "True Trip" or other abbreviations.
The abbreviation "TTK" cannot be said in Roblox chat, mainly due to it containing a sensitive word. Instead, the player can use "True Trip" or other abbreviations.
If the True Triple Katana's fourth M1 is used in the air, the user would then be able to travel greater distances than the [Z] move.
The True Triple Katana deals the third highest M1 damage out of every fighting style or sword in the game.
If [Z] Wolf Fang Rush is used in a corner of a wall, the player has a chance to glitch through.
[X] Dragon Hurricane can pull enemies much farther than the hurricane's hitboxes.
[X] Dragon Hurricane can go through thin walls like the walls of the Mansion (Third Sea).
This is the sword with the highest mastery-requiring obtainment.
The True Triple Katana can be obtained even without finishing the Colosseum Quest, but it will be extremely difficult without the Manager's help in finding the Legendary Sword Dealer.

swords.name: Cursed Dual Katana
swords.description: Obtained via puzzle; high damage. Abilities: Revolving Ravager, Slayer of Goliath.
swords.wiki_description: Obtained via puzzle; high damage. Abilities: Revolving Ravager, Slayer of Goliath.
swords.page_description: The Cursed Dual Katana is a Mythical sword.
trivia: Cursed Dual Katana is often abbreviated as "CDK" by players.
The Cursed Dual Katana deals the fourth highest damage per click out of every sword in the game (the third is True Triple Katana, second is Bisento V2, and the first is Triple Dark Blade).
[Z] Revolving Ravager is as fast as Dark Blade's X move, but Dark Blade’s X move has more range.

[X] Slayer of Goliath requires 375 Mastery, the second highest move mastery requirement in the game. Only Death Step's Maximum Overheat is higher, at 400 Mastery.
Despite this, once a player reaches Cake Land, NPCs yield relatively more mastery, making it easier to grind past this point.
Despite this, once a player reaches Cake Land, NPCs yield relatively more mastery, making it easier to grind past this point.

Using Godhuman's [Z] (Soaring Beast) move while the opponent is trapped inside the tornado from Cursed Dual Katana's [Z] move will cause the move's animation to follow the opponent who is trapped inside the tornado.
The Cursed Dual Katana is considered one of the best swords in the game by the community due to its versatility and attack power.
The Cursed Dual Katana, along with Shark Anchor, are the only swords in the game that ignores Dragon's defense buff.

A glitch that requires the player to use [X] Slayer of Goliath and immediately unequip the sword from their hotbar will freeze the target in place, rendering them unable to move until they die or switch teams. This has been patched.

swords.name: Dark Blade
swords.description: Purchased or gifted; dark slashes. Abilities: One Thousand Slices, Dark Air Slash.
swords.wiki_description: Purchased or gifted; dark slashes. Abilities: One Thousand Slices, Dark Air Slash.
swords.page_description: The Dark Blade is a Mythical sword.
trivia: The Dark Blade makes the user spin when they do an Air Jump or side dash. The user will also do a roll when they back dash.
The Dark Blade was previously called the "Yoru" which was then changed to Dark Blade.

There is a triple version of the Dark Blade, named the Triple Dark Blade.
This version is only usable by admins or people they granted it to.
This version is only usable by admins or people they granted it to.
The Dark Blade is the only sword that requires obtaining a Game Pass to obtain.
The Dark Blade is technically the only sword that can be traded, because the player can store it in the form of a Game Pass.
The Brazil Cube allowed the first player who touched it to receive Dark Blade. However, it could only be spawned in by an admin.
The Dark Blade is the only sword that has an alternate skin.
The Dark Blade is one of the swords that are difficult to use, due to requiring decent aiming and prediction skills.
The [X] Dark Air Slash from its V1 has higher stun duration than its V2 counterpart and smaller AoE.
The Dark Blade is one of the few items in the game to have its rarity altered.
The Dark Blade is often abbreviated as "DB". Check Dictionary for more info about such abbreviations.
The Dark Blade is recommended for all seas as it has high damage and low mastery requirements and are comparable to swords like Cursed Dual Katana, True Triple Katana, or Shark Anchor.

swords.name: Hallow Scythe
swords.description: Dropped by Soul Reaper; Halloween-themed. Abilities: Grim Reaper, Soul Harvest.
swords.wiki_description: Dropped by Soul Reaper; Halloween-themed. Abilities: Grim Reaper, Soul Harvest.
swords.page_description: The Hallow Scythe is a Mythical sword.
trivia:
The Hallow Scythe is the first sword to have a unique mechanic.
The less health the opponent has, the more damage the player will do with this weapon and life-leeching abilities.
The less health the opponent has, the more damage the player will do with this weapon and life-leeching abilities.

The Hallow Scythe was once used to kill an admin with extremely high HP. In this video, a player used a combo with Portal [C] to teleport the admin into the lava in Hot and Cold, then dragged them into it using the sword’s [Z] move, resulting in an instant kill.

The engravings on the blade of the scythe mean "Death", while the engravings on the tang of the scythe "風間" can be read as Kazama in Japanese, meaning "Between Wind". Both the engravings combined make the word "Death Between Wind", alluding to Death Cyclone.
The Hallow Scythe is used by the Lv. 2100 Raid Boss, Soul Reaper.
The Burning blessing does not visually appear on Hallow Scythe.

swords.name: Fox Lamp
swords.description: Obtained via Kitsune Shrine; air-based. Abilities: Fox Fire, Ember Dash.
swords.wiki_description: Obtained via Kitsune Shrine; air-based. Abilities: Fox Fire, Ember Dash.
swords.page_description: The Fox Lamp is a Legendary sword.
trivia: The Fox Lamp is known for its extremely powerful high stun ability, extremely fast attacks and especially really good in the air.
The Fox Lamp is more recommended for grinding by pairing it with Buddha.
The Fox Lamp does not turn black when Aura is active, though Aura colors still appear. (Similar to Shark Anchor)
Despite being a sword, the Fox Lamp resembles a lamp rather than a common blade.

The Japanese symbols (キツネ) shown when charging [Z] Scorching Azure and [X] Infernal Firestorm (The player can briefly see the symbols as it is spun at a very fast speed), mean "Kitsune" which when translated means "Fox" in English ("Kitsune" can also be written as the kanji character "狐").
The [X] move, when tapped, bears a slight resemblance to Dragon Talon's [Z] move, Talon Lighter.
Fox Lamp's [M1] attacks' sound effect is similar to Dragon Breath and Dragon Talon, but with a slightly lower pitch.

guns.name: Slingshot
guns.description: Basic ranged weapon that shoots pebbles. Abilities: Pebble Shot, Quick Fire.
guns.wiki_description: Basic ranged weapon that shoots pebbles. Abilities: Pebble Shot, Quick Fire.
guns.page_description: The Slingshot can be purchased for   5,000 from the Weapon Dealer at middle town in first sea.
trivia: Slingshot is the first gun and the only Common gun in the game.

Slingshot does the least amount of damage out of all the guns in the game.
Slingshot deals lower damage than Combat.
Slingshot deals lower damage than Combat.
Slingshot has the lowest range out of any gun in the game.
Slingshot and Rocket both cost the same price.

guns.name: Musket
guns.description: Single-shot firearm with decent range. Ability: Piercing Shot.
guns.wiki_description: Single-shot firearm with decent range. Ability: Piercing Shot.
guns.page_description: The Musket can be bought for   8,000 from Weapon Dealer, who is located in Middle Town, First Sea.
trivia: The Pistol Billionaires in the Third Sea uses the old version of the Musket.
The Musket's M1's (click) cannot be used on Chromebook, unless it is touchscreen.
[Z] Draconic Bullet has similar VFX to [Z] Venomous Spit of Venom Bow.

guns.name: Flintlock
guns.description: Dual pistols for quickfire. Ability: Rapid Barrage.
guns.wiki_description: Dual pistols for quickfire. Ability: Rapid Barrage.
guns.page_description: The Flintlock is an Uncommon gun.
trivia: The Flintlock's M1's (click) cannot be used on Chromebook, unless it is a touchscreen.
The Flintlock's icon does not match its model.

guns.name: Acidum Rifle
guns.description: Shoots toxic projectiles. Ability: Acid Blast.
guns.wiki_description: Shoots toxic projectiles. Ability: Acid Blast.
guns.page_description: The Acidum Rifle is a Rare gun.
trivia: The Acidum Rifle is widely used in PvP due to its ability to break Instinct, have large AoE stun moves, and extremely high damage.
When equipping this gun, backflip animations when jumping and dashing will not show, although the user is still able to use them.
There may be visual glitches when the Acidum Rifle appears in front of the player's character. This is due to the avatar's arms, and the player will need to change their avatar's arms to fix it.
Acidum Rifle is the only gun that goes around to any players back.
Many players in the community complain about the rework making the Acidum Rifle's moves harder to hit. Although it was "fixed", it is still arguably worse than pre-rework.

guns.name: Serpent Bow
guns.description: Powerful bow infused with venom. Ability: Venom Arrows.
guns.wiki_description: Powerful bow infused with venom. Ability: Venom Arrows.

accessories.name: Black Cape
accessories.page_description: The Black Cape is a Rare accessory.
trivia: It is recommended to obtain the Black Cape as soon as possible due to its buffs being extremely good for players in the First Sea.

accessories.name: Pink Coat
accessories.page_description: The Pink Coat is an Uncommon accessory.
trivia: The Pink Coat is only recommended for gun mains starting out.

Despite a lack of substantial offensive boosts, Pink Coat is commonly used by First and early Second Sea players for the increase in health it provides.
The Pink Coat is usually one of the first accessories players obtain, which may be why it is fairly common to see it being used.
The Pink Coat is usually one of the first accessories players obtain, which may be why it is fairly common to see it being used.

accessories.name: Tomoe Ring
accessories.page_description: Tomoe Ring is a Rare accessory.
trivia: It is not recommended for players to buy the Tomoe Ring because of the high cost. Instead, saving   500,000 to buy other things (Instinct, Water Kung-Fu) is a lot better.
If the player does not meet the requirements to purchase Tomoe Ring, Yoshi will say "You're not ready yet, brat." when spoken to.
The Lv. 575 Boss, Thunder God wears the Tomoe Ring but does not gain any buffs from it.
The Tomoe Ring's description says that it is a metal ring with tomoes, but instead of having tomoes, it has yin-and-yang.
The Tomoe Ring, along with the Swordsman Hat and Lei, are the only accessories that provide a buff to only one stat.

accessories.name: Ghoul Mask
accessories.page_description: The Ghoul Mask is a Rare accessory.

races.name: Human
races.description: Balanced stats. Upgrade gives clutch survival abilities.
races.wiki_description: Balanced stats. Upgrade gives clutch survival abilities.
races.page_description: Human mainly supports damage and a bit of mobility. Due to high damage increases, Human can assist the player greatly when they wish to perform one-shot combos and improve their PvP skills. However, mastering this race is not easy because it does not provide any defense.
trivia:
Combining Human with the Kitsune Ribbon lowers the player's Flash Step cooldown to 7.5 seconds.
However, Psycho (both Tier 1 and 2) while in V4 isn't affected by the buffs granted by the accessory.
However, Psycho (both Tier 1 and 2) while in V4 isn't affected by the buffs granted by the accessory.
Human grants the user a permanent extra dodge for Instinct.
Human deals insane damage when used with high combo potential fruits like Dough.

races.name: Fishman (Shark)
races.description: Allows swimming and stronger water attacks.
races.wiki_description: Allows swimming and stronger water attacks.

races.name: Cyborg
races.page_description: Cyborg's special abilities allow the player to fight and combo more effectively in close quarters, by disabling Instinct or by dealing extra damage and increasing their own defense. This race is mainly used against teamers due to its ability to deal extremely effective wide-area damage. In general, this race is great for grinding, PvP against Teamers and especially breaking combos. Additionally, it is also good for breaking Instinct and doing combos with Instinct-trickable attacks. However, the V3's average range is also a slight drawback, and the V4's damage output is not a good choice in 1v1s.
trivia: The damage reduction from Cyborg V2 (10%) and V3 (30%) combined is 37% (not 40%).

races.name: Ghoul
races.description: Life steal abilities and night bonuses.
races.wiki_description: Life steal abilities and night bonuses.
races.page_description: Ghoul provides various stat boosts, most notably increasing the user’s speed during the night and allowing the player to leech health from other players, making it excellent for survivability and overall combat effectiveness. It is a great choice for PvP due to its ability to reduce cooldowns quickly and enhance mobility, alongside powerful life leech when awakened to V4. This race is strong in almost every aspect except for relatively weak armor support, which is compensated for by its life leech abilities. Ghoul does not require switching to another race after obtaining it from the Experimic, similar to Draco.
trivia: Ghoul V3 with Dino Hood can outrun Mink V3 user with Pilot Helmet.

locations.name: First Sea
locations.description: Starter sea with basic islands like Jungle, Pirate Village, and Desert.
locations.wiki_description: Starter sea with basic islands like Jungle, Pirate Village, and Desert.
locations.page_description: The First Sea is the starter sea for the game and the location that players spawn in when they join the game for the first time.
trivia: Usually, higher level players are around the Jungle since this is the most popular place in the First Sea.

locations.name: Second Sea
locations.description: Unlocked at level 700. Includes Dressrosa, Green Zone, and Ice Castle.
locations.wiki_description: Unlocked at level 700. Includes Dressrosa, Green Zone, and Ice Castle.
locations.page_description: To access the Second Sea, the player must be Level 700 or above. Once they have reached this level, they must talk to the Military Detective and they will receive a special key. They then must travel to the Frozen Village and go to the cave where the Ability Teacher is, opening the wooden door with the previously mentioned key. Inside the cave will be the Ice Admiral, who must be defeated. Once this has been done, the player can return to the Military Detective, who will tell them to talk to the Experienced Captain located on the left side of the Middle Town. Talking to the Experienced Captain will allow the player to travel to the Second Sea.
trivia: The player can skip going back to the Military Detective as they already have access to the Second Sea even without talking to him.
Awakened Buddha is the most efficient fruit for farming in the Second Sea, due to its M1 range being highly increased.

locations.name: Third Sea
locations.description: Unlocked at level 1500. Features Floating Turtle, Haunted Castle, and Sea of Treats.
locations.wiki_description: Unlocked at level 1500. Features Floating Turtle, Haunted Castle, and Sea of Treats.
locations.page_description: Players can get access to the Third Sea by reaching Lv. 1500, after completing the Colosseum Quest, defeating Don Swan and helping King Red Head subdue rip_indra in the Second Sea.
trivia: The Third Sea holds the title of having the least number of islands (8); however, more are to come. It also could be counted as 12 islands, as there are several mini-islands in the Sea of Treats or 17 if the Mirage Island, Kitsune Island, Treasure Island, Frozen Dimension and Prehistoric Island are included.
The enemies past the Ice Cream Land (Sea of Treats) use Aura, nullifying Elemental Reflex even if the player surpasses the required Level.

updates.details: Added Kitsune fruit, new swords, bug fixes, balance changes.
Added Celestial and Creation fruits, new race abilities, awakened sound fruit.
Added T-Rex and Mammoth fruits, new raids, and fighting style buffs.
